description:
Mother Tongue- Opening Event, Join us to celebrate the opening of Mother Tongue, opening event 27th of August, Wednesday 5.30pm
The exhibition with run till September 20th
Wednesday to Friday 11-2pm
Weekends 11-4pm
Mother Tongue is a love letter written in paint. Three mixed-race artists from across Te Ika-a-Māui — Carmel Aroha Salmanzadeh, Jessica Miku and Anthony Zemke — trace the echoes of matrilineal language and culture, reaching for words that live in their mothers’ voices but not their own. The show speaks to the intricacies of love, loss, grief and gratitude. To inherit a tongue but not its fluency is to stand at the threshold of intimacy — close enough to hear it, yet unable to fully enter. At its heart are nine paintings that pursue a multifaceted visual language that expresses the artists’ ability (or inability) to connect without language.
To love without saying “I love you” – “ka nui taku aroha ki a koe” / ”دوستت دارم” / “いつもありがとう”
Anthony Zemke (b. 1998, Aotearoa) is an Iranian-Pākehā illustrator and painter based in Tāmaki Makaurau.
Working within a conceptual framework guided by the Baha’i teachings, Eastern mysticism, and Continental philosophy, Zemke’s practice sees abstraction as the ideal vehicle for communicating psychosocial and spiritual realities. His works explore the boundaries of language, the dialectic of human oneness and diversity, and the various dimensions of radical compassion.
Carmel Salmanzadeh (b. 2002, Tāmaki Makaurau) is of Māori, Iranian, Samoan and Chinese descent. He uri tēnei nō Ngāti Hauaa, Waikato, Te Aitanga-a-Hauiti, Ngāti Ira me Ngāti Porou. Salmanzadeh traces links
between the pictorial languages and motifs used in the traditional and indigenous practices of her multiethnic
whakapapa; exploring how visual narratives transcend cultural boundaries. Manifested in large-scale pieces, their works are influenced by the structure and design of Persian carpets, Samoan siapo and Māori taniko.
Jessica Miku (b. 2000, Whangārei) is a Japanese/Pākehā artist based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Using the Japanese cultural anthropological concept Hare-Ke, which harmonises the fantastical with the mundane, they produce paintings of imagined female figures within ecological fantasy. These portals of otherworldliness are used to explore notions of tenderness—in heart, soul, and flesh.
Promotional Design by Tamara Irvine
This exhibition will be accompanied by a written work by Yue Pibrow

In ‘Over and Out’, premiering at the 2025 TAHI Festival, he’ll bring you a REAL interview, a BIG character, and even bigger QUESTIONS to the stage. One actor. 50 minutes. Countless emotional potholes ‼️

Along the way, we get a rare look into the gritty, heartfelt, and often-overlooked life of one of Aotearoa’s essential workers — the truck driver 🚛

Is the open road calling — or is the stage his true destination?

Buckle up. This is verbatim theatre with serious mileage.

description:
Painted Past: Tribute to the Heritage City of Ahmedabad, An exhibition Sandip Prajapati celebrating the architectural heritage of Ahmedabad, India.
Opening Hours
Tuesday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm
Sunday: 11am - 4pm
Ahmedabad, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage City in 2017, is renowned for its rich architectural heritage and cultural significance, showcasing a blend of Indo-Islamic architecture and vibrant local traditions.
Born in Patan, Gujarat, Sandip Prajapati has always been fascinated by the rich history and culture of the region.
An architect by profession, he uses his knowledge of design and structure to capture the essence of the pol houses. Pol houses are traditional residential buildings that are clustered around narrow streets and courtyards in the old city of Ahmedabad. They date back to the 18th century and reflect the influence of various communities and religions that coexisted in the city. Pol houses are known for their intricate wooden carvings, ornamental facades, and colorful decorations. They are also a living testimony of the social and harmony that prevailed in the city.
CONTACT
Website: sprajapati.com
Instagram: @sandipprajapati1

description:
Pebble - Love In Every City, Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.
Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!

description:
ROADKILL: The Uber-cool Musical - TAHI Festival, Hey everyone- we have a little change of plans!
Unfortunately, ROADKILL: The Uber-Cool Musical won’t be happening this time around, but we’re already cooking up something even better for the future. All ticket holders will receive a full refund and we can’t wait to welcome you to our next big adventure.
Thank you for your excitement and your support.
ROADKILL The Uber-Cool Musical takes you on a wildly immersive journey through love, life and rock ’n’ roll — all from the back seat of a van. This intimate one-man musical combines humour, heart and unforgettable tunes for an experience like no other.
Strap in for the rollercoaster ride of your life as we take a regular mundane occurrence of driving in an Uber and blow wide open the private life, memories and miss happenings of our hero, and driver, Terry.

Carpool karaoke meets intense love story meets wild murder mystery.

Much more than a musical, its an experience, its a journey and an attraction!

In the space of a usual cabaret show and with the help of the passengers in the van, you will witness and be part of, childhood dreams, births, deaths and marriages, high drama, dark comedy, all sung live with a kickass, original, meatloaf-esque rock soundtrack. Surprises and magic ensues as we push the van, and Terry, to the limits of what is possible.

This will be an intimate, sensory overload, in a van. A full grand musical with all the bells and whistles.

With only 9 seats available each ride, grab your mates and have a private experience in the fast lane!
The hottest ticket in town- be sure to experience the ride of your life!

The show is in the style of a musical crossed with karaoke songs you have never heard before...

The van will be stationary and parked for this initial season.

Winner of BEST IN FRINGE and EMERGING ARTIST OF THE YEAR at the Dunedin Fringe and Winner of MOST INNOVATIVE at the NZ Fringe awards this year!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Ravel’s opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges', New Zealand School of Music Classical Performance students present four performances Ravel's engagingly magical opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges' at the Hannah Playhouse directed by Sara Brodie, conducted by Martin Riseley with the New Zealand School of Music orchestra.

Performed in French with subtitles, the show is suitable for all ages. The story involves a 'child' (L'enfant) whose awful behaviour brings an unexpected response: first the furniture rebels, the grandfather clock, the broken china cup, then the mathematics tutor and the Princess in the fairy tale book come to life, and eventually all the animals in the garden - squirrels, dragonfly, birds rise up - all of whom have good reason to 'teach the child a lesson'. It's a fabulous journey that we go on with the child who is confronted by all of these and indeed learns...

This is a project involving the whole of the Classical Performance programme: the voice students sing all the roles, each performing several roles, the NZSM orchestra will play for the performances, and the piano students are taking part as rehearsal pianists (répétiteurs) and playing in the orchestra.

Lighting design by Alex Fisher, set and costumes by Grace O’Brien, assistant director Theresa Hanaray, chorus master Kathryn Mosley, the show has been coordinated by NZSM Head of Classical Voice Jenny Wollerman in collaboration with the Toi Whakaari technical programme staff, graduates, and students
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Red!, Red!
Step into a world where fairy tales come alive with imagination, music, and creative collaboration. Lucy Mulgan’s Red! The Opera—a fresh and engaging retelling of Little Red Riding Hood—invites audiences of all ages to experience opera in a new, interactive way.

This vibrant one-act opera takes the well-loved story and gives it a bold, modern twist. Red is no longer a passive heroine but a spirited and resourceful young girl who learns to stand up for herself. Along the way she encounters a mischievous Wolf, a feisty Granny, and a host of colourful characters who bring the forest to life with humour, warmth, and plenty of surprises.

At the heart of Red! is participation. Children take an active role in shaping the performance—creating sound effects, movements, and responses that become part of the show. Their voices blend with professional singers and musicians, making every performance unique and alive with energy. The result is a joyful celebration of music, storytelling, and community.

Mulgan’s score is witty, playful, and sophisticated, full of catchy rhythms, lyrical arias, and imaginative textures. It captures the drama and comedy of the tale while remaining approachable and fun for newcomers to opera. Both seasoned opera-goers and first-time audiences will find themselves swept up in the sparkle and charm of this inventive work.

With its empowering message, interactive spirit, and musical brilliance, Red! is an opera for today’s families—offering laughter, excitement, and a reminder that even the smallest voices can make themselves heard.

description:
Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night, Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night
A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)

DATES
Wed 27 Aug 2025 - Sat 6 Sep 2025

description:
Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone), Award-winning Australian comedian Rory Lowe is bringing the chaos to New Zealand!
Fresh from sold-out tours across Australia and Asia—and with his first comedy special about to be filmed—Rory hits NZ for the very first time with an hour of wild stories, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered laughs.
From getting arrested for terrorism, to snitching on a meth head, to getting married and failing miserably at quitting the party life, Rory’s real-life tales are as ridiculous as they are hilarious. Expect raw, real, and unpredictable comedy from one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today.
Critics and audiences can’t get enough:
★★★★★ – What’s On In Adelaide:
“Comedy at its finest! Lowe draws us in with his unique stories and larger-than-life personality… absolutely guarantees a f*&#ing funny hour of laughs!”

★★★★½ – Fourth Wall Media:
“Rory Lowe is absolutely killing it in the comedy scene… Fast-paced and non-stop, the jokes are funnier every year and the crowd interaction is spot on.”

★★★★ – The AU Review:
“Time flies when watching Rory, a non-stop comedian, with ready-made jokes and quick wit to keep the crowd on its toes.”
With over 2.2 million YouTube subscribers as part of YeahMad, 475K TikTok followers, and a reputation for high-energy, off-the-wall shows, Rory Lowe is ready to take New Zealand by storm.
One man, one mic, and an hour of absolute mayhem—get ready for Rory Lowe unleashed.

description:
Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson, Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson
Saturday Laughs returns to the Upper Hutt Cossie Club, with another great line up of top Kiwi comedy

With MC Ben Hurley
As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

And headline act Josh Thomson
Josh is a household name and a legend on the New Zealand comedy scene. He has been a mainstay on local comedy shows like 7Days, Have You Been Paying Attention, was the regular comedian on The Project and was the champion of Season 3 of TaskMaster NZ – which he now directs. He also directed and starred in a web series about his own father Subject:Dad.

As an actor he’s appeared internationally in Prime’s The Office Australia, Netflix’s The New Legends Of Monkey, NBC’s Young Rock and local hits Good Grief, Creamerie, Wellington Paranormal, Educators, Time Bandits and the Emmy winning INSiDE. His feature film work includes the How to Please a Woman (Australia), Don’t Make Me Go (US), and local favourites Gary of the Pacific, Pork Pie, & Guns Akimbo.

Josh continues to work as a live performer, whether gigging on tour with 7DaysLive, appearing on the Comedy Gala, hosting the Great Comedy Debate or as an MC for corporate events. He’s hosted the NZ Film Awards, the 48Hour Film awards, various Vodafone events and several spots for the NZ Music awards.

Book early and often!

September features guest headline act, Wilson Dixon
Hailing from Cripple Creek Colorado, country music legend, Wilson Dixon’s melodic philosophies on life have seen him become one of the most loved characters on the Aust, UK and NZ circuit.
He has had sold out season’s at The New International Comedy Festival and has won awards for Best Show and in 2010 he won the supreme Festival Award The Fred for outstanding artistic achievement.
Before sweeping the New Zealand International Comedy Festival his show ”Wilson Dixon’s American Dream” played to rave reviews at the Edinburgh Fringe and Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Directly after the Edinburgh Fringe Wilson went on to appear in his own 4 part radio series for the BBC – The Wilson Dixon Line.
An unmissable act!

Scene Painting, Scene Painting
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's the final show of the 2025 New Zealand Improv Festival, and we're bringing together some of our favourite performers for a once-in-a-lifetime show.

Improvisers will often paint a scene, using narration to conjure images in the mind of the audience. But what if they could actually paint the scene?

Thanks to the generous support of Resene Paints, we'll be doing just that: actually painting our scenes onto the stage and walls at BATS. Come send off the Festival with a messy, beautiful explosion of colour!

description:
Small Towns, Kiwi Summers, Small Towns, Kiwi Summers
Presented by Tempest Theatre Co.
Directed by Emma Maguire

Forests, beaches, unbearable ennui — it's no picnic being from one of the most rural places in Aotearoa. Sometimes the best day of your life is sitting in a horrible carpark outside the Warewhare cause there's nothing else to do.

There's a tragedy in being in a place that's so far away from everywhere else. On the longest day of summer, join my friends and yours as we dream, wonder, and hope that things aren't going to change too much come February.

An improvised dramedy about leaving home, finding your feet, and fighting your way out of the wop-wops.

description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like, Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like
THIS SHOW IS R16.

Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts

Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.

Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.

Living is Like - Directed by Andrea Ferpo

Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.

Living Is Like harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

description:
Split Bill: Sohn Zone & D.E.I.'s, Sohn Zone - Rich & Rebecca Sohn

The Sohn Zone is a half hour of comedy, improvised in form and content, from Second City, Annoyance and iO Chicago veterans, Rich and Rebecca Sohn.
This show is organic. They trust each other, the audience, improv, and the moment to find their form. Nothing is decided beforehand.

Rich and Rebecca Sohn met as improvisers in Chicago over 30 years ago. As long-time teachers, this duo show began when former students asked them to headline a new evening of improv. Students often expressed surprise at how different their teaching styles were and took to saying “you’re in the Sohn zone” when seeing the couple work together.

D.E.I.'s - Mo Munn & Ralph Hilaga

When two besties land jobs at a prestigious company, they discover they’re not there for their skills — they’re the token hires. What follows is an improvised journey of chaos, corporate jargon, and an earnest attempt to prove they’re more than just the diversity checkbox.

From the chaotic minds of Wellington improv duo Mo and Ralph, D.E.I.’s is a sharp, satirical, improvised workplace comedy about tokenism, identity, and the conundrums of modern day allyship. If you’ve ever wondered what happens when the diversity quota starts talking back — this is it.

As the Sohn Zone is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. D.E.I.'s contains strong language and adult themes, and discussions of topics like racism, queerness, and tokenism. Some material may touch on lived experiences of marginalisation and may be confronting for some audience members.

Both shows may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Storytelling with the Unicorn!, Stories handcrafted right before your very eyes.

The Unicorn is the last of a long line of spontaneous storytellers, and today he's come out of hibernation to weave tall tales to impress small people. Using improvisation and audience participation The Unicorn welcomes all ideas to create a story that will never be told again. Come be a part of the magic.

As performed by Derek Flores

Inspired by masters such as Groucho Marx and Bugs Bunny, Derek has pursued a life in comic theatre. At a young age he became a student of Keith Johnstone, (author of “Impro” and creator of TheatreSports), and a Loose Moose Theatre alumni which saw him through a life as a street performer and cabaret act throughout festivals in Canada, Australia, Europe, and NZ. Eventually finding himself on at The Second City Toronto where he co-wrote and performed two mainstage shows and shared the stage with Colin Mochrie and Robin Williams.

"...a magnificent improviser and storyteller..." -Theatreview

description:
The Amber Temple at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington, The Amber Temple marries mysticism with gritty, ghoulish escapades of rogues and renegades. Vignettes of characters similar to you, similar to me, similar to someone you may have been or may one day become, all on the path towards the Amber Temple.
From the bowels of the molten earth, to the jowls of the predatory opportunist, to the angel casting light from celestial constellations, you will find yourself wrapped in a web from a sliver of time, a faraway place, perhaps an unknown space, as musician and dancer weave their tall tales of trials and tribulations, mortal life and looming death, unwavering love and venomous hate, environmentalism and satirical social commentary.
An original music and interpretive dance collaboration between singer-songwriter Julian Temple and contemporary dancer Amber Stephens.
Temple, known mostly for his work in the eponymous Julian Temple Band has written all new works for the project while Stephens, a trained contemporary ballet dancer and choreographer who ran her own dance company in Vienna, has choreographed the interpretive dance for this unique performance.
“A live dancer added a visceral element to an already emotional performance. Having a responsive artist interacting and interpreting the music through movement only heightened the experience. It bridged the gap between performer and audience.”
- Ed Castelow - Dictaphone Blues
“You’ll be a converted fan of The Amber Temple before they’ve even finished their first song. There’s an obvious sense of originality, coupled with carefully crafted dance moments and some of the most intense and outstanding folk songwriting you’ve heard. There’s a feeling though that nothing is premeditated and that improvisation is the star of the show - the kind of performance that requires decades of experience. Luckily for us, Julian and Amber have this in spades. Do yourself a favour, I guarantee you’ve seen nothing like it.”
- Sam Cullen - Singer/Songwriter
“Even having an understanding of the type of show The Amber Temple would be putting on when booking them - I was blown away by the amount of drama, tension and world-building Julian & Amber are able to accomplish in such an agile performance. The Amber Temple is a totally unique and utterly engaging experience which should be seen and celebrated.”
- Chris Scott - Seaside Music
Show starts at 7 Presale tickets $20 (+BF) via undertheradar.co.nz or $25 on the door
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible

The Art of Ikebana exhibition, The Art of Ikebana exhibition
Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.

Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.

Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm

Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.

This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.

description:
The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg & Emma Barnes | Writers on Mondays, Three extraordinary poets introduce their new collections, books of poetry brimming over with feeling, and taut with intellectual curiosity. Amy Marguerite (over under fed), Sophie van Waardenberg (No Good), and Emma Barnes (IF WE KNEW HOW TO WE WOULD) talk with Anna Jackson about the conditionality of rapture, the loveliness of loneliness, the difficulty of living in a hungry body, how it has felt to keep writing through a pandemic, heart-break and grief, and why it matters to make space for metaphor and memory, for sparrows and bees and a guinea-pig, eating a dandelion, its mouth full of gold.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

description:
The Dictionary of Moments, The Dictionary of Moments
Directed By Jason Geary

This isn’t your ordinary dictionary.

Here, you won’t find dry definitions — instead, every word unlocks a moment from a story that brings its meaning to life.

Drawing from his acclaimed short story podcast of the same name, Jason Geary reinvents storytelling onstage with this bold hybrid of live-written tales and spontaneous scenes. Each performance is a one-of-a-kind experience where language leaps off the page and into vivid, unscripted life.

Part literary experiment, part theatrical adventure — words have never been this alive.

description:
The Life of Henry the Fifth, A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Made-Up Smackdown: Favourites Box, Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

A long-standing Festival highlight, The Made-Up Smackdown is a thrilling, unpredictable competition of late-night improvisational glory.

For the final night of the Festival, all the teams picked as audience favourites in the previous Made-Up Smackdowns reassemble for one last time, to answer the ultimate question: what will they do to win a second box of chocolates?

Come and enjoy a selection of favourites from previous nights, and decide which is your favourite favourite!

description:
The Music Made Me Do It, Directed by Jamie Burgess

Watching Jaws with the sound off = nice movie about fishing.
How about Star Wars while wearing earmuffs?

Lord of the Rings played with the Friends theme tune on repeat?

Music can make or break a blockbuster.

Let's see what happens when we devilishly mess with the soundtrack for an hour featuring some of the world's best visiting improvisers!

Expect awkward silences, melodramatic moments, powerful pauses, and guffaws galore as the music makes everything better (we hope).

description:
The Pantoloons: Cinderella, Glass slippers, royal balls, and a Fairy Godmother who’s still on her learner’s licence, what could possibly go wrong?

Prince Percy is hopelessly charming (emphasis on hopeless), the Queen is busy approving new royal wave techniques (it’s very hard work being a Queen!), the step-sisters are causing chaos in couture, and Buttons has big dreams!

Will true friendship win over fairy-tale romance? Will Buttons dreams come true? And who is behind the kingdom’s mysterious gossip vlog? Packed with music, mischief, and magical mayhem, this is Cinderella with a twist, a tune, and a whole lot of sparkle! Step into a spellbinding world of wonder where dreams shimmer, magic floats on the breeze, and anything is possible… but only until the clock strikes twelve!

REVIEWS FOR RED RIDING HOOD

“You guys were amazing, thank you so much. Me and the kids had an amazing time. We can’t wait for the next holidays t come see you again.”

“My kids had a blast! My little man was in hysterics at Mr Moa.”

“Love everything that you do and each time gets better and better.”

A boy is stranded at sea. A storm bears down on him, and, in what he believes are his final moments, he ponders his life and the choice he made to come here—to explore what’s over the curious horizon—and wonders: Was this a mistake? There once was a boy… is a fun, poetic performance for tweens, teens and their whānau. This live “pop-up book” explores curiosity, courage, and finding light in the darkness.

This Wasn't The Plan: A Musical Theatre Cabaret, This Wasn't The Plan: A Musical Theatre Cabaret
This sold-out Pōneke favourite returns for one night only at Hannah Playhouse. Please take your seats in this cabaret classroom as lecturer, acclaimed musical theatre performer Glenn Horsfall, takes you through the twists and turns of a life imagined versus a reality lived. Glenn lays bare his journey of self-discovery, from the highs of childhood fame to the lows of bullying and self-doubt. With beautiful songs and hilarious, heartfelt, humbling stories, this show looks at what it means when the script of life gets rewritten. This Wasn’t The Plan picked up the Auckland Fringe Tour Ready Award and Outstanding Solo Performance Award at NZ Fringe 2025. It’s a must-see for anyone navigating change or questioning societal expectations.

description:
Tom Sainsbury — Lessons not Learnt, He’s met with success across stage, screen and social media. Tom Sainsbury is a multi-talented New Zealand comedian, actor and writer. He’s bringing his new show ‘Lessons not Learnt’ to The Opera House in spring. Tom’s comedy is distinctively Kiwi. It often reflects New Zealand’s culture and idiosyncrasies through a satirical lens. 
For many, Tom is a household name thanks to his viral Instagram skits and impressions. Beginning in 2017, they skewered famous politicians and events of the day. His satirical pen has also been used to write for television, web series, and film. In front of the camera, he’s starred in Taskmaster NZ, Wellington Paranormal, Snackmasters, Shortland Street, along with countless theatre productions. Whether he’s playing a dodgy small-town mayor, a passive-aggressive flatmate, or a ghost-hunting cop, expect razor-sharp character comedy.

description:
WELLINGTON, NZ - Coal Miners Daughter - 7.30pm, WELLINGTON, NZ - Coal Miners Daughter - 7.30pm
Coal Miner’s Daughter celebrates the incredible life of the late great Loretta Lynn.

Amber Joy Poulton (Loretta Lynn), Lizzie Moore (Patsy Cline) and The Preacher Denis Surmon (Conway Twitty & Willie Nelson), along with kickin' band The Holy Men, will sing the story of and celebrate Loretta Lynn. In floor length gowns adorned with tassels and rhinestones, with hair as close to country music heaven as possible, where country music started and still should be, in the theatre, just like the Grand Ole Opry, and it's coming to New Zealand!

This inspiring show was a smash hit at the 2025 Tamworth Country Music Festival and has played to packed theatres across Australia since its debut in 2017, but it's New Zealand that has been screaming out for a tour and the cast couldn't be more excited for their first New Zealand tour in October 2025. They will have you tappin' your toes, tilting your head and falling in love with country music all over again with hits like 'Coal Miner's Daughter', 'You Ain't Woman Enough To Take My Man', 'Crazy', 'You're Lookin' At Country', 'Walkin' After Midnight', 'One's On The Way', 'Stand By Your Man', 'Faded Love' and more.

This is a show not to be missed!

"Loretta Lynn paved the way for women like me in country music to take centre stage" - Amber Joy Poulton star of Coal Miner's Daughter

What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money. 
Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...

World Press Photo 2025 exhibition, This photography exhibition features powerful, thought-provoking images from around the world. The event brings together photographers and storytellers whose work highlights pressing social, environmental, and political issues.
This year’s event coincides with the 70th Anniversary Retrospective (1955-2025) – a celebration of iconic images and stories from seven decades of the World Press Photo competition. The retrospective offers a historical journey through the evolving art of photojournalism and marks an era that also gave birth to rock ‘n’ roll.
Also featuring :
• Photography by Woolf 90th Anniversary Exhibition
• The Photographic Society of New Zealand
• The Nature Photography Society of NZ
• The Woolf Te Papa Collection includes special archival and historical content and work by leading NZ Photographers such as Brian Brake.
• Dates: Daily from Friday September 5 – Sunday October 5, 2025
• Venue: Takina, Exhibition space, Ground Floor Wellington
• Host: New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts (NZAFA)
• Tickets: Adults $21. Under 14 $11. Ticket sales at the door.

description:
World Press Photo Exhibition 2025, Gathered from across the globe, step into stories that matter. The World Press Photo Exhibition 2025 brings compelling images captured by photojournalists and documentary photographers around the world. They capture powerful moments from world events that help people better understand issues of today. You’ll see stories of migration, climate change, war, protest, family, animals, sport, and more. 
This year’s World Press Photo competition attracted 59,320 entries from 3,778 photographers across 141 countries. A global jury chose 42 winners across six regions and three categories. These stunning images can be seen at the Tākina exhibition centre in Wellington from 5 September to 5 October.

description:

Two novelists take the pulse of life in Aotearoa and diagnose a hilarious and dangerous arrhythmia. Brannavan Gnanalingam’s The Life and Opinions of Kartik Popat takes the gloves off to better prod the weeping sores of our body politic and social media. Duncan Sarkies depicts the farcical and chilling demise of democracy within an alpaca breeders’ association in Stargazers. Join Pip Adam as she asks both writers about the serious intent behind the hijinks and why it’s a good time to wield the satirical scalpel.

ADMISSION IS FREE—ALL WELCOME
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

description:
Writing Off The Map: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill | Writers on Mondays, Nina Mingya Powles calls Anna Jackson's Terrier, Worrier 'a remarkable and playful book on language, anxiety, poetry, and the strangeness of being a person'. Somewhere between a diary and a collection of poetic essays, it takes Jackson's work into previously uncharted territory.
Equally off the charts is film-maker, writer, and artist Rachel O'Neill's Symphony of Queer Errands, a delightfully riotous musical fantasia and an irreverent ode to queer joy.
Chris Price will pilot the conversation between these adventurous voyagers in unknown seas.

Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. description:
ration the Queen's veges, Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
1st Joint SETAC AU & ACTRA Conference, We are excited to invite you to join us in Te Whanganui-ā-Tara Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand from 25-28 August 2025 to experience the first ever joint Society of Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry Australasia (SETAC AU) and the Australasian College of Toxicology & Risk Assessment (ACTRA) conference.
The theme of this year’s conference is:
“Building a lasting legacy: Our choice, their future”
What legacy will our work leave for future generations?
Rooted in an understanding of the impacts of chemicals and emerging challenges, this conference will explore how diverse knowledge systems, collaborations, and innovative educational and engagement strategies can secure a better outlook for generations to come.
Scientists, knowledge keepers, practitioners, and end-users from diverse fields will share their research, insights, and strategies, fostering collaboration for improved environmental outcomes.
Hosted by The Environmental Protection Authority Te Mana Rauhī Taiao
https://www.epa.govt.nz/

An Actionable Plan: Breakdown your big goals into clear, doable weekly steps, making it easy to stay on track and see real progress.
Inspiration & Connection: Learn, share, and grow alongside other business owners, gaining fresh insights, motivation, and a powerful networking opportunity.
Why You Need This Now:
Without a business plan, you are more likely to miss opportunities, waste time, and burn out.
Businesses with formal plans are more likely to succeed and achieve long-term growth.
The time to act is now - this session is your key to getting your business forward successfully.

description:
BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua, Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.

description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Scott Simpson, Join us on Tuesday 7th October for our next Beehive to Business event with Hon Scott Simpson, Minister for ACC and Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs.
The newest Minister in the coalition Government, but not a first time Minister – Minister Simpson brings 13+ years of experience in politics to his new roles.
As the Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs, Minister Simpson sits at the heart of some of the most significant economic questions facing the business community and the country - regulation, financial markets and of course, competition, are all areas in the spotlight for which he is responsible for.
From Minister of Statistics to Chief Government Whip, to his current portfolios - Minister Simpson is more than well equipped to bring the insights of the Beehive to Business.
This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.

With local Government decision making in the spotlight as we head into local body elections, there is no better Minister in the Government to hear from than Minister Watts.
Minister Watts is at the forefront of some of New Zealand’s most pressing issues – be it the energy market, water service delivery, or taxation, the decisions Minister Watts heads up are pivotal to New Zealand – and your business.

description:
Build your Professional Board of Directors, You’ve got colleagues to vent to, friends to debrief with, and maybe a podcast or two for inspiration… but when was the last time you had an intentional conversation about your career? It’s time to change that. 
While coaching and courses get all the attention, there's another powrful tool that often gets overlooked: a Professional Board of Directors. The women who navigate pivotal career moments best? They don't do it alone.
Just as companies need a board to guide them, you deserve a trusted circle to help with career decisions, fresh perspectives, and ongoing accountability.

This interactive 2-hour session is for women at every stage - from new graduates to senior leaders. Over a few drinks and snacks, you’ll:
Learn: What a professional board of directors is, how they work and why they’re so impactful.
Connect: We’ll pre-match you with 4-5 others at a similar stage and situation. This will be your board for the evening!
Experience: Your first board meeting. We'll provide instructions and a simple agenda.

Bonus: Your ticket comes with a free 3-month Powrsuit membership (worth $147). Designed for busy people, Powrsuit combines bite-sized learning, peer coaching, and micro-networking in one all-inclusive membership. With weekly live events and on-demand access through our web and mobile apps, you will make step-by-step progress in your career, on your terms.
Note: While all genders are welcome in the Powrsuit network, this event is for Women+. Want to join as an Ally or learn more about what we do? Get in touch.

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.

description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington, Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

description:
Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams, This course is designed for leaders, managers, and organisational change agents who want to foster a positive workplace culture that drives high performance, collaboration, and employee wellbeing. Participants will explore the essential principles of creating an environment that nurtures trust, accountability, inclusivity, and engagement. Through practical strategies, case studies, and interactive discussions, participants will learn how to develop a culture that motivates teams to excel, encourages open communication, and supports professional growth.

Key Topics Include:
• Building a culture of trust and psychological safety
• Fostering open communication and feedback loops
• Aligning values and purpose with organisational goals
• Promoting inclusivity, diversity, and belonging
• Recognising and celebrating achievements
• Encouraging work-life balance and wellbeing
• Developing strategies for conflict resolution and collaboration
By the end of the course, participants will have the tools and insights needed to create a workplace environment that not only supports but accelerates the success of high-performing teams, driving both individual and collective achievement.

Key audience:
This course is designed for leaders, managers, and anyone responsible for shaping the culture within their teams and organisations.

Learning outcomes:
Implement strategies to cultivate trust, psychological safety, and high performance within their teams.
Lead teams that foster open communication, collaboration, and inclusivity.
Align team goals with organisational values and objectives, ensuring a shared sense of purpose.
Develop effective strategies for conflict resolution and team cohesion.
Create a workplace culture that encourages growth, well-being, and work-life balance.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details:
Duration: Full day, in person.
Time: 9am – 4pm
Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea.

Customer Service Essentials, This course will cover the importance of creating a customer service mindset when dealing with your most important asset in a business, your customers. It introduces the key requirement to have a strong product knowledge, effective communication and listening skills, and polished customer service etiquette.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for employees who interact with customers on a regular basis, whether by phone or in person, and people who would like to gain a strong, foundational level of knowledge about how to deal effectively with customers.

Understand the importance of a customer service mindset.
Learn about customer service etiquette and how it’s unique for each business.
Explain the requirement for a strong product and service knowledge.
Demonstrate the pivotal role of good communication and listening skills.

description: Customer Service Excellence, A fantastic one-day course to get staff communicating professionally and confidently with customers. Keep your customers coming back by empowering staff with core communication and customer service skills along with a ‘can do attitude’. For the better part of every day, we are communicating to and with others. This workshop will equip participants with the skills and techniques required to transform how you manage relationships with customers, colleagues and stakeholders. Have you ever thought about how you come across to others and what it’s like to be on the receiving end of you? This workshop will help participants to understand the different methods of communication. Whether it’s the speech you deliver to your customers and work colleagues, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look that you give to the cat, it all means something! Each and every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not. Maybe you’re in a frontline position serving the people who buy your products. Perhaps you’re serving staff members in other departments within your organisation. Learn ways to communicate with customers in a professional and positive manner, build rapport authentically, provide a great customer experience each and every time, build loyalty and repeat business, handle conflict and much more. This course also covers telephone etiquette, email and face-to-face. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 22-24 September 2025, The ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures and organisational change.

"Highly recommend."
"Inspiring."
"An amazing experience."
"One 'aha moment' after the other."

Founded on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, Dare to Lead™ is an empirically based courage-building programme, delivered by Boma New Zealand CEO and Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator Kaila Colbin.
Brené has spent two decades studying shame and more than seven years specifically looking at leadership. During her research, she interviewed leaders from all over the world — from Fortune 100 companies, non-profits, public sector entities, and more — and asked one question: what is the future of leadership?
Remarkably, their answers pointed to one thing: we need braver leaders.

We need more courage.

The most significant finding from Brené’s latest research, and the foundation of Dare to Lead™, is that courage is a collection of four skill sets that are teachable, measurable, and observable.

After completing the three-day Dare to Lead™ programme you'll understand how to:
Effectively navigate vulnerability and unlock change
Turn values from fluffy language into tangible, practical behaviours
Build a common culture of trust in your team
Cultivate the skills to rise from setbacks and be more resilient

This curriculum is essential for teams who want to:
Be better equipped to deal with difficult conversations
Reduce unhealthy and unproductive behaviour
Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust

This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role

Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special price of $1,995 + GST when you register.
We also have partial scholarships available to attend the programme. Apply here and we’ll be in touch.
Boma is a Regional Business Network Provider. Your organisation may be eligible for funding support to attend this programme. Find out more at regionalbusinesspartners.co.nz

Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.

Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.

Contact us
Please email hello@boma.global with any questions.

 Pikselin: Pikselin is a New Zealand based consultancy and solution provider in the digital engagement and application development space. Pikselin delivers responsive websites, intuitive interfaces, and inclusive digital services for clients across government and private sector. description:
Electra Business After Five - 21 August 2025, We're delighted to welcome Jerry Shearman from Central Economic Development Agency (CEDA) which connects people, place and business in Manawatū. 
 
Jerry, a former scientist with a passion for data and insights, believes strongly in evidence-based decision-making.  With over 15 years’ experience in senior leadership roles within the tertiary education sector, Jerry brings a wealth of expertise in strategic thinking, stakeholder engagement, and turning vision into action, as evidenced by some of the exciting things happening in the area which Jerry will share with us. 
 
Join us for an evening of insight and inspiration and hear one of the region’s most dedicated leaders talk about: 
Te Utanganui - designed to be New Zealand's third major distribution hub, complementing the Golden Triangle (Auckland-Hamilton-Tauranga) and the Christchurch-Rolleston node. Te Utanganui is a transformative multi-modal logistics and distribution hub located in Palmerston North, it serves as a vital link in the national freight network currently going through transformational changes connecting road, rail, air, and sea transport systems. 
Manawatū Regional Food Strategy, our Land Diversification initiative and the complementary capability between regions
Regional NZ - the need to work together, shared populations, future growth plans
Electra Business After Five
Thursday 21st August 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf
Te Takeretanga o Kura-hau-pō, Levin

description:
Electra Business After Five - MONDAY 22 September 2025, September Electra BA5 Showcase 
Woodhaven Gardens 
Join us for an exclusive behind-the-scenes experience at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most community-minded businesses.

Join us for a rare behind-the-scenes look at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most innovative businesses.
Founded in 1978, Woodhaven now spans 1,800+ hectares, grows over 20 vegetable varieties, and employs 250+ staff. 
Discover how they combine tech innovation, sustainability, and community investment to contribute $30–35M annually to Horowhenua’s GDP.

Speakers:
Emma Clarke – Woodhaven Gardens: Innovation, sustainability, and community impact.
Deborah Manning ONZM – Founder of KiwiHarvest & NZ Food Network: Transforming NZ’s food rescue and sustainability landscape.
You are invited to view Woodhaven's operations from 5.30-6 pm before the speakers begin. 
Deborah Manning ONZM, Lawyer turned social entrepreneur who is a trailblazer in sustainability and food security, transforming New Zealand’s food rescue landscape through her venture KiwiHarvest, and the New Zealand Food Network. In 2025, Deborah was awarded the New Zealand Sustainability Leader of the Year Award at the Kiwibank New Zealander of the Year Awards.
Horowhenua Mana Kai Network, born from a January 2025 hui on rising food insecurity, the Mana Kai Network connects local kai initiatives to create long-term change. Hear how this community-led, Council-supported collaboration is improving food access and equity across Horowhenua.
WOODHAVEN GARDENS
44 Joblins Road, Levin
Monday 22nd September 2025
5.30-7 pm  

This event is in partnership with Woodhaven Gardens, Horowhenua District Council, Mana Kai and Muaūpoko Tribal Authority.

description:
Empowering Aotearoa New Zealand’s Digital Future, You’re invited to the launch of NZTech’s latest landmark report: Empowering Aotearoa New Zealand’s Digital Future – Our National Data Centre Infrastructure.
Data centres are the backbone of our digital lives, powering everything from essential government services and healthcare to banking, e-commerce, and artificial intelligence (AI).  As data centre demand rises, so does the need for a resilient and sustainable energy supply. This sector is playing a pivotal role in New Zealand’s transition to a low-carbon future and helping to future-proof the electricity grid.
Discover what’s really happening with New Zealand’s booming data centre sector and what it means for our economy, communities and our digital future. Meet the data centre operators and electricity providers driving this transformation, and hear directly from Hon Simon Watts, Minister for Energy and Climate Change, and Graeme Muller, CEO, NZTech.
 Join us and find out:
how data centres power our everyday lives and the scale of New Zealand’s data centre sector
how the sector is fuelling economic growth and generating thousands of jobs
why New Zealand’s data centres are global leaders in energy efficiency and driving investment in new wind, solar and geothermal projects
how New Zealand is uniquely positioned to become a regional hub for sustainable digital exports.
the importance of collaboration between government and industry to ensure renewable energy supply can keep pace with digital growth. 
Learn more about how the digital economy and energy sector are working together to unlock new value for all New Zealanders, ensuring our country thrives in a rapidly evolving digital world.

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest

description:
Leadership Play Day - Wellington, Leadership Play Day: Wellington 17th October 2025
Friday 17th October 2025 | 8:30am–5:00pm
Location: Nairn Street Cottage, 68 Nairn Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011

What this day is all about
Leadership Play Day is a full-day, game-based learning experience that takes leadership development out of the boardroom and into play. Instead of being talked at with boring slides, you’ll step into three carefully designed games that let you actually practice leadership.
You’ll be experimenting, problem-solving, laughing (a lot), and walking away with insights that stick because you’ve lived them, not just heard them.
This isn’t theory. It’s leadership in action.
Learn more at our website.
How it works
The day is made up of three 2-hour games. You can book individual sessions ($99 each), or join us for the full day ($297) to play all three and unlock The Leadership Playbook - a bonus 60-minute facilitated debrief where we connect the dots and help you take away a clear set of personal leadership shifts.
Here’s what’s on in Wellington:
The Moonlit Market (8:30–10:30am)
Pitch, trade, and negotiate under pressure. Build agility, creativity, and bold decision-making in a playful, high-energy marketplace.
The Broken Bridge (11:00am–1:00pm)
A fantasy quest to practice difficult conversations. Explore courage, clarity, and how you show up when the stakes feel high.
The Inner Tides (1:45–3:45pm)
Use the Emotional Culture Deck in a role-playing game to strengthen emotional awareness, resilience, and confidence in leading with empathy.
The Leadership Playbook (4:00–5:00pm)
Available only with a full-day pass. A guided reflection session to connect your learning, extract insights, and leave with a practical playbook you can use back at work.
Why you should join
Practical skills, not theory - you’ll walk away with tools and insights you can use immediately.
Safe practice, real challenges - rehearse tough moments without real-world consequences.
Energy + engagement - no sitting back, you’ll be on your feet, in the mix, learning by doing.
Unique approach - game-based leadership development you won’t find anywhere else in NZ.
Whether you’re a leader, facilitator, HR/People professional, or just someone curious about growing your leadership edge - this day is designed for you.
Tickets
Individual game session: $99
Full day pass (all 3 games + Leadership Playbook debrief): $297
👉 Ready to roll the dice on your leadership?

Spots are limited - grab your ticket today.

description:
Leadership and Management Part 3, Leaders today are expected to be the driving force of their teams. They are constantly under pressure to lead effectively in a business environment that is characterised by constant change. Our leadership and management courses offer participants the opportunity to develop the necessary skills to embrace this challenge and lead their teams through these times with confidence and pride.

Our Leadership & Management - Part 3 workshop is a practical skills training course designed for people already in a leadership/management position, or those about to take up a new role, who want to explore the latest thinking and models for effective management and leadership and build on the techniques acquired in our Part 1 and 2 workshops.

In today’s world, emotional Intelligence is a critical and powerful component of effective leadership. This 2-day course will equip leaders with the skills to become more ‘people smart’ by developing ways to lead with emotional intelligence. Participants will also learn how to inspire their people with a shared vision and align teams to company goals, along with the tools to lead and manage change, ways to become a more influential and persuasive leader and the tools to raise awareness and manage unconscious bias in the workplace.

description:
Managing for value: building a strong financial advice business-Wellington, Building a valuable financial advice business means you have a resilient business to support your clients and a strong asset. Transactions – acquisition and disposal support the long-term growth and sustainability of financial advice provider businesses. Transactions take many forms, going concerns regularly acquire and dispose of clients, business units, lines of business, have investors buy-in, bring key staff together – and split businesses up. Only a small number of our transactions are the classic market exit.
Our aim is to spend time talking with advisers about how to grow their business and manage for value – making their business more valuable by explicitly thinking about valuation in addition to the other metrics such as profit and cashflow.

description:
Meet the Buyer Te Whanganui a Tara, Ehara taku toa i te toa takitahi, engari kē he toa takitini
Kia ora koutou, Noaˈia ˈe mḁuri, Kia Orana, Ni Sa Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Mālō e lelei, Malo le soifua, Malo nī, Faka talofa atu, Kam na mauri.
After some very successful Meet the Buyer events in both Porirua and Fielding, we are taking Meet the Buyer to the Capital.
The mission of Amotai is – Building sustainable wealth for Māori and Pasifika. One of the most important ways we do this is through our mission – to unlock opportunities for Māori and Pasifika businesses through supplier diversity.
We are very excited to engage Māori / Pasifika businesses in our nations capital in the second half of our Meet the Buyer programme for 2025. We have some great relationships with Wellington City and Greater Wellington Regional Council, as well as Tier 1 businesses. We are look forward to providing this awesome platform for our Amotai Buyers to connect with Māori and Pasifika businesses to all Amotai suppliers throughout the Wellington region, nau mai, haere mai.
Nau mai, hoki mai ki tēnei whakangahau whanaungatanga. Nau mai, haere mai ki te hono, ki te koorero me te mahi tahi a Suppliers me Buyers o Amotai.

description:
NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape, NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape
This Forum brings a wider range of people involved in critical infrastructure resilience to learn and discuss the latest developments.

About this Event

Welcome to NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape!
This Forum brings together people delivering infrastructure resilience to discuss the latest developments and opportunities.
We welcome attendees from critical infrastructure organisations, regional Lifelines Groups, CDEM Sector, research agencies and others, working to improve New Zealand’s infrastructure resilience and the wellbeing of our communities.


Feature Sessions:
National Resilience Perspectives.
The First ‘R’ - Reducing Risk
Enhancing Resilience – Regulatory and other Levers
Community Resilience to Lifelines Failures
Engineering more Resilient Infrastructure
Intelligence for Readiness and Response
National Planning for Lifelines Readiness and Response.

Interactive Sessions:
• Opportunities for discussion and networking.

Keynotes:
• Political and executive leaders influencing infrastructure resilience.


Associated Forum Events
Wednesday 15th October 2025, 12.30pm - 4.30pm, Lifeline Utility Coordinator Forum (invite only).
Thursday 16th October 2025, 5.30pm – 7.00pm
Social Event tbc. All attendees invited.
Friday 17th October 2025, 7.15am – 8.45am: Breakfast meeting for Programme Managers and Chairs of regional Lifelines Groups (invite only)

Monthly Topic: Powerful Email Marketing
Hosted by: Bryony Richardson
This month, we’re diving into Powerful Email Marketing, because your inbox might be the most underestimated goldmine in your business. Whether you’re building community, driving sales, or nurturing long-term clients, email marketing allows you to connect on a deeper level (without having to battle the unpredictable social media algorithm).
In September, we’ll be sharing ideas, swapping tips, and uncovering what makes a newsletter not just opened but loved. From juicy subject lines to irresistible calls-to-action, get ready to rethink the power of your email list.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?

As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities.
Join the Inner Circle
Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits:
Monthly Masterclasses: Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset.
Accountability Calls: Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals.

Join the Inner Circle now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.
Empower Her is a global female networking community, that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences.
Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.
Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments.
Join our free community
The Inner Circle
Follow us on Instagram
Empower Her Co-Founders Victoria and Charlotte are highly passionate and dedicated to empowering female leaders in the business world. By joining Empower Her, you will not only expand your professional network but also gain access to a supportive community of like-minded individuals who are committed to helping each other succeed.Find out more about us and check up our upcoming events on our website.

description:
New Zealand Vocational Education and Training Research Forum, Rebuilding together.
Ngā mihi nui ki a koutou katoa

Skills Group and BCITO are delighted to join forces to return NZVETRF as a unique national event to showcase and disseminate new and emerging research and innovation in Vocational Education and Training.
Since 2004, the NZVETRF has been the must-attend event for policy makers, researchers and practitioners engaged in vocational education, across all parts of the tertiary sector and industry.
The vocational education sector is transforming through both policy and technological change. Knowing 'what works' and what is emerging is more critical than ever as a new network of provision for vocational education and training is established.
Over a day and a half you'll hear from international and national keynote speakers, government and sector stakeholders, the learner voice, and debates on the hot topics, along with curated and competitively selected research and evidence presentations.

Places are limited - register now to secure your place at Aotearoa's pre-eminent cross-sector vocational education event.
Call for Abstracts Now Open
We now invite researchers, practitioners, and policy makers to submit abstracts for presentation at the Forum. As part of New Zealand's premier VET research platform, your contributions will help shape New Zealand’s future as our sector moves forward.
Submission Guidelines
Abstracts should be no longer than 300 words and outline your completed research and intended presentation. We particularly welcome submissions that address one or more of our key conference themes:
·       Workplace learning and Industry Training
·       Diversity, Access and Equity
·       Developing our Future Workforce
·       Technology and Innovation
·       Learner Journey and Outcomes
·       Collaboration and System Approaches.
Your research should demonstrate evidence-based outcomes, share good practice, support high-quality research networks, and inform policy development. We encourage submissions that honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi and incorporate Māori perspectives in VET innovation.
Submit your abstract here
Submission Deadline: 5pm, 17 September 2025
An assessment panel comprising representatives from Skills Group, BCITO, and an independent assessor will evaluate all submissions. Successful presenters will be notified by the end of September 2025.
Keynote Speaker Announcement
We are delighted to announce that Kathryn Rowan, Executive Director of Switzerland-based Global Apprenticeship Network will address the Forum.

Kathryn is a seasoned leader with a background in human resources and corporate social responsibility, who brings a wealth of experience from her previous role as Vice President of Human Resources, Zone Latin America, and Global Youth Lead at Nestlé. Throughout her career, Ms. Rowan has consistently demonstrated a passion for harnessing the power of business to drive positive change in society. During her tenure at Nestlé, in national, regional, and global roles, she promoted initiatives to strengthen leadership and capability building, diversity, and corporate reputation, while spearheading youth-focused efforts, including the Global Alliance for Youth.
The Global Apprenticeship Network was established in 2014 by ILO, the International Organisation of Employers (IOE), the Organisation of Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), and Business at OECD. GAN is governed by a private-sector led, multi-stakeholder coalition representing major global corporations and international organisations, GAN's primary role is to encourage businesses to implement apprenticeship and WBL programs and support the creation of an enabling policy environment.
Further programme details and speaker announcements will be made in coming weeks, so register now!
Your Co-Hosts
Skills Group is New Zealand's largest Private Training Establishment, supporting 17,000 learners and training across 33 industries, through both work-based and provider-based learning, across 15 campuses nationwide.
BCITO is New Zealand's largest provider of Apprenticeships, having qualified 55,000 tradies and counting, across 15 construction and allied trades.

Skills and BCITO gratefully acknowledge Ako Aotearoa, the Centre for Tertiary Teaching Excellence, for support and permission to carry this event forward. We acknowledge Ako's enormous contribution to VET research and this event over many years. NZVETRF is a taonga, and as co-hosts we are committed to upholding the mana of the event.

Partner with us.
NZVETRF is all about walking the talk on sector collaboration. We warmly invite interest from interested education and industry partners to join on as event supporters. Sponsorship and event supporter packages are available. Contact nzvetrf@skills-group.org for details.
