description:
Painless Presenting - Tuesday 18th November, Full day presentation skills workshop in Wellington. Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
Who's it for?
You work in a technical field. You’re great at your job — but struggle to get your ideas across the business.
You often:
Dive into technical detail that loses or confuses your audience
Overload people with too much information, which makes it harder to get the results you need
Find it tough to explain complex areas of your role in a way others can easily understand
Spend hours planning presentations, yet still feel stiff and uncomfortable when delivering
Feel nervous when presenting, and wish you could speak with more ease and confidence
If this sounds like you, Painless Presenting will help you cut through complexity, present clearly, and build the confidence you know is vital for your career growth.
What you will learn:
A proven step by step process that will take the pain out of planning presentations and set the foundations for becoming a more engaging, natural and effective business presenter.

Participants are taught how to write a valuable business presentation, how to manage their nerves, design useful visuals and are given key delivery techniques to help deliver their presentations in a natural and engaging way.
You will come away with:
an understanding of how to use the SpeakerMap™ system, a step by step, proven approach to planning presentations quickly and effectively
a new appreciation of purpose when speaking
an understanding of how to quickly design useful presentation visuals
how to easily overcome the problems of speaking too fast, um-ing and ah-ing, and losing your place
a tailored strategy to dissolve the anxiety that so often accompanies presenting
three delivery tricks that will help you come across as credible and confident
Note: You will not need to present to the group on this course. If you are interested in a more intensive training option, including one on one coaching, check out our 2 day workshop The Effective Speaker.
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

description:
Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille, Kia ora e te whānau EHF,
You're invited to a very special evening!
Join us on Wednesday 27 August at 5:30pm for a heart-filled poroporoaki, a chance to celebrate Rosalie Nelson, and to officially welcome our new Co-Executive Directors, Elizabeth McNaughton and Shaquille Shortland.
📍 Te Wharewaka Function Centre, Wellington
🕔 Doors open at 5:00pm | Welcome begins at 5:30pm sharp
🕢 Event concludes by 7:30pm
👔 Dress: Business casual
To RSVP (button)
To register to join online (button)
This will be a joyful evening of reflection, reconnection and looking ahead. Whether you're joining us in person or online, we’d love to have you in the room (or on the screen!) as we mark this milestone in the life of the Fellowship. You are also welcome to bring your partner.
In te ao Māori, a poroporoaki is more than a farewell; it's a ritual of transition and gratitude. A moment to steady the waka, acknowledge the hands that have guided it, and prepare together for the voyage ahead.
We’ll honour Rosalie’s contribution, and we’ll raise a glass to Elizabeth and Shaquille as they step into their new roles. Expect warmth, good company, big-hearted kōrero and a few surprises too.
If you're planning to attend in person and haven’t yet booked travel, now’s a good time to do so.

Ngā manaakitanga,
The EHF Board

description:
Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly., Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.
At MOX, we're a small, family-run business based in beautiful Aotearoa, New Zealand. Founded and led by two partners who've shared life's journey for over 25 years, we bring a unique blend of personal commitment and professional expertise to every interaction.

We're not your typical consultants. Instead, we're hands-on experts in procurement and contract management, driven by a desire to create real, lasting change. Our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes, helping you secure the best deals, avoid pitfalls, and gain the kind of commercial protection usually reserved for the big players. We believe in enabling your success by ensuring your contracts and purchasing processes truly work for you.

Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.

Procurement Case Studies - The Bad: How things can go wrong and cost you $$$.
Contract Myth Busting - The Ugly: Why we should embrace contracts; they aren’t “ugly”.
Best Practice - The Good: How good procurement & contracts will “save the day” and protect your business.
Contract Counselling: Tell us about your “bad(s)”. We will guide you on how you can make it “good”.
We have an amazing new innovation that we want to introduce at the session (during the Best Practice part) called Kitset Contract. Kitset Contract is going to empower sole traders & small to medium sized enterprises to truly be able to create and use their own contracts; Allowing them to better protect their business and their hard earned $$$.

Everyone who attends the session will receive a discount code meaning their first contract will be only $49.99 (a $100 discount).

RSVP Here: https://www.kapitichamber.org.nz/events#!event/2025/8/5/l-d-procurement-contract-myths-8211-the-good-the-bad-the-ugly

You may also like the following events from Kāpiti Business Chamber:

description:
Reimagining Construction: Participatory, Circular, and Open by Design, This presentation examines how the principles of participatory, circular, and open design can transform construction by bringing human and ecological values into the heart of how we build.
Drawing from both ancient timber framing traditions and modern innovations, it demonstrates how modularity and standardisation unlock flexibility, efficiency, and customisation while supporting sustainable, locally-rooted solutions.
A key focus is placed on design for disassembly and reassembly, enabling buildings and their components to be reused and adapted over time—reducing waste, lowering environmental impact, and fostering resilience for current and future communities.

description:
Stage 2 Health and Safety Representatives, The purpose of this two-day course is to extend the skill level of H&S Representatives. Stage 2 training focuses on specific risk and hazard identification and controls, approved Codes of Practice and using accident data to identify trends and develop preventative actions across the core elements of your workplace H&S system.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who have completed the Stage 1 course and are interested in taking their skills to the next level. It would also be useful for anyone who would like to know about the requirements for the role or who have employees in these positions.

Learning outcomes
Identify and report on links to productivity due to improved health and safety practices.
Determine injury causal factors from incident reports and notifiable events.
Provide detailed feedback to H&S Committee meetings for further action.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details
Duration: two full days, in person.
Time: 9am-4pm
NZQA Unit Standard: 17593 ( Assessment costs additional)

description:
The Inevitabilism Panel, We're told AI is Progress, progress that cannot be stopped, that it will change the way we work and live, from business to education and the commons. But who says? Whose progress and whose AI is it anyway? Is societal progress really bound to technological innovation, or are there other ways of reading - and even shaping - positive social change?
Technological Determinism is described as the belief system that social progress is driven by technological innovation, which in turn follows an "inevitable" course." This panel will take a good hard look at this 'inevitabilism' - its forces and politics - with a view to our shared future in Aotearoa and the Pacific.
Join us for a rigorous evening of discussion with a view to how we might gain more understanding - and more say - as to the reach and influence new technologies have over our autonomy, dignity, communities and cultures.

description:
The Power of Successful Cross-Sectoral Collaboration: A Real-World Example, From Pilot to Powerhouse: The BEATS Research Journey
Presented by Dr Sandra Mandic
In a world where complex challenges demand bold collaboration, the BEATS Research Programme stands as a beacon of what’s possible when sectors unite with purpose.
Join Dr Sandra Mandic as she shares the remarkable 10-year journey of BEATS—an award-winning, interdisciplinary initiative that brought together academia, local government, schools, and communities across Dunedin. From its humble beginnings in 2013 to its international recognition by 2023, BEATS exemplifies the transformative power of shared vision, strategic leadership, and cross-sectoral teamwork.
In this session, you’ll discover:
🔍 How BEATS advanced scientific knowledge while serving real-world needs
🤝 What made its partnerships thrive across disciplines and institutions
🧭 Key lessons in leadership, adaptability, and long-term sustainability
🚀 Insights to inspire your own collaborative projects and research endeavours
Whether you're in education, policy, research, or community development, this talk offers a compelling blueprint for building impactful, resilient collaborations.
Explore the full story at AGILE Research – BEATS Programme
About Sandy
Dr Sandra Mandic, PhD, PMP is a transformational leader, innovator and award-winning researcher and author. Sandra’s personal and professional journey spans nine cities across five countries and three continents – including Europe, Canada, United States and New Zealand. She speaks four languages and has experience of working in academia, government and business sectors. Sandra was the founder and lead researcher on the award-winning BEATS Research Programme (2013-2023). She is also the founder and the director of the research consultancy AGILE Research Ltd. and the creator of the Compass Guide Research Training resources which currently include four books and over dozen research training and project management courses.
More information about Dr Mandic’s background and the link to her brief curriculum vitae:
https://agileresearch.nz/about-the-author/

The Workplace Rituals Deck Facilitator Masterclass, Build culture by design, not by default - one ritual at a time.
Facilitate meaningful culture change and create connection through the power of workplace rituals.
This masterclass is for people who want to build stronger, more connected workplace cultures — and are ready to turn values and intentions into real, daily action.
Whether you're a leader, culture champion, facilitator, or change consultant, this training will give you the tools and confidence to run your own Workplace Rituals Workshops using the WRD (Workplace Rituals Deck).
Led by the co-creators of the deck, Lotty Roberts and Lorissa Garcia, this is a hands-on learning experience rooted in emotional culture, intentional design, and purposeful leadership.
In this Masterclass, you'll learn:
What rituals are and why they are important
Why rituals matter in workplaces
The difference between habits and rituals
Indepth knowledge of each of the 4 parts of the deck and why they are important
How to use our PARR model to craft rituals that stick
How to run the Rituals Audit
How to guide groups through ideation, crafting and action
Lotty & Lorissa's tips and tricks for using the deck first hand, along with the story and background behind the deck.
You'll walk away as a Certified Workplace Rituals Deck Practitioner, with confidence to run rituals sessions with your own teams or clients.
What's Included:
3.5 hour in person masterclass
Co-led by the WRD creators: Lotty Roberts & Lorissa Garcia
Certification as a WRD Practitioner
Digital Toolkit
Option to purchase with or without a deck.
Who it’s for:
Leaders & Team Managers
Culture Champions
Small business owners wanting to create an intentional culture as they scale
HR, OD, and Change Practitioners
Leadership Development Consultants
Facilitators & Coaches
Anyone who wants to turn values into action and create emotionally intelligent, connected teams and workplaces
Why Join? Because culture doesn't live in a document. It lives in the small, intentional things we do every day. This masterclass gives you the tools and confidence to help others design those moments — and build workplaces where people feel connected, seen and supported.
Culture happens with or without you - rituals help make it intentional.
Presented by the WRD Co-creators:
Lorissa (founder of Assembly Culture) and Lotty Roberts (founder of MiND.U) met through their shared work in emotional culture, leadership, and change - and quickly became friends as well as collaborators.
After years of working with teams and leaders, they kept noticing the same thing: workshops sparked insight, but translating that energy into everyday action was where things fell short.
So they created The Workplace Rituals Deck - a practical, human way to close the gap between knowing and doing. It’s full of simple, powerful rituals to help teams shape a culture that’s not just talked about, but genuinely felt.

description:
Treasury Guest Lecture with Michael Keen: IN-PERSON attendance, Join us for our special Fiscal Policy for the Future seminar
New Zealand faces significant long-term fiscal challenges, including the rising costs associated with an ageing population, increasing demand for public services, and the need to adapt to a changing global economy. These pressures will require careful planning to ensure the sustainability of government finances while maintaining fairness and efficiency in the tax system.
Inland Revenue’s draft Long-Term Insights Briefing explores these issues by asking critical questions about the future shape and scale of our tax system. Similarly, the Treasury’s Long-Term Fiscal Statement highlights the importance of future-proofing our tax framework and other broader policy settings to address these challenges.
Join us for this seminar delivered by a highly regarded economist and expert in tax policy and administration, and a prolific author, Michael Keen, as he shares his insights on future proofing our tax system.
This will be a hybrid event, and we encourage you to attend it in person for an opportunity to engage in a discussion on all those issues with our guest speaker.
About this event
This will be a hybrid event. Please use this site to register if you plan to attend it in person.
If you would like to attend it virtually, please use THIS LINK to register.
The Tax Policy Charitable Trust has arranged Mick’s visit to New Zealand. The Trust was established to support leading tax policy thinking in New Zealand. You can read about the Trust’s work here.
About the presenter
Michael (Mick) Keen is a former Deputy Director of the Fiscal Affairs Department at the International Monetary Fund, where for over twenty years he played a central role in shaping and delivering IMF policies and advice on tax matters.
He has advised finance ministries in all parts of the world, including missions to over forty countries, and led the preparation of influential papers for the G20 and the Executive Board of the IMF.
Before joining the Fund, Mick was Professor of Economics at the universities of Essex (UK), Queens (Canada) and Kyoto, and is now Ushioda Fellow at the University of Tokyo.
Mick was the keynote speaker at the 2014 conference on the Future of Tax Administration in New Zealand and has provided peer review for Inland Revenue’s previous Long-Term Insights Briefing.
Mick has jointly authored, with Joel Slemrod, Rebellion, Rascals and Revenue – an entertaining account of how history illuminates the perennial challenges and timeless principles of taxation—and how the past holds clues to solving the tax problems of today.
About this seminar series
New ideas, innovative concepts, research evidence and expert advice are all crucial to stimulate and inform the Treasury’s economic analysis and advice. Our current theme for guest lectures - Fiscal Policy for the Future - explores the role of stabilising, sustainable and effective fiscal policy. Speakers provide insights into how fiscal policy can be designed to support government to meet its current and future objectives and obligations while adapting to changing circumstances and delivering value to the New Zealand public.
Fiscal policy has a stabilising role in helping to smooth the business cycle, while sustainability in fiscal policy is foundational for resilience to both shocks and longstanding challenges, such as climate change, technological advancements, and demographic trends. Ensuring effective and value for money expenditure is important so that fiscal policy contributes to the living standards of New Zealanders, both now and in the future.
Please note that the views, opinions, findings, and conclusions expressed in the Treasury Guest Lecture Series are those of the individual presenters. They do not necessarily reflect the views of the New Zealand Treasury or the New Zealand Government.
For updates and our latest research visit: www.treasury.govt.nz
Keep in touch
If you would like to be the first to hear about our upcoming events in the Treasury Guest Lecture Series, please SUBSCRIBE to stay up to date.

description:
Wellington Before9: Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?, Join us for "Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?," an engaging Before9 (Breakfast event) discussing the latest strategic direction of the technology in Aotearoa New Zealand.
New Zealand's first national AI strategy has arrived, aiming to boost productivity and encourage the uptake of AI "with confidence." But as we move forward, a critical question remains: what does "responsible AI" actually look like in practice for businesses and organisations in Aotearoa? This panel discussion will delve into the nuances of the government's new strategy, exploring its impact on our collective journey. Our panel will unpack the challenges and opportunities presented by a "light-touch" regulatory approach and discuss how we can build a uniquely Kiwi framework for responsible AI in New Zealand.
Our panel will be made up of the following individuals:
Zoe Udy, Deputy Chair at TUANZ
Sasha Vlassoff, Senior Policy Advisor at InternetNZ
Plus one other
Zoe in particular will be able to give an update from our meeting with the Parliamentary cross-party caucus on AI.
We look forward to hosting you at this Before9.  This event is free for members of InternetNZ and TUANZ.  This is a number limited event to 30 individuals so make sure you register early.
Please note the formalities will start at 7:45am but you can arrive any time after 7:30am.

We're pleased to invite our members and CFA candidates to another Women in Finance lunch, this time with guest speaker; CFA charterholder, Christina Leung, CFA, Deputy Chief Executive & Principal Economist, NZIER
About our presenter
Christina Leung, CFA is Vice Chair of the CFA Society New Zealand and Deputy Chief Executive (Auckland) and Principal Economist at the NZ Institute of Economic Research (NZIER), where she looks after economic forecasts and analysis of the Quarterly Survey of Business Opinion. Christina also works with many clients looking at topical issues, including the wider economic impact of particular industries and investments. She previously worked at the Reserve Bank of New Zealand and ASB. Christina holds a Bachelor of Commerce with first class honours in Economics.
Christina will talk about her career journey and share her experiences of being a woman in the world of economics and finance.

description:
'WOMB WOMEN' Workshop for Women, IMAGINE...100 THOUSAND GRANDMOTHERS SPANNING BACK THROUGH 2.5 MILLION YEARS OF HUMANITY. ONE WOMAN GIVING BIRTH TO THE NEXT, ON AND ON THROUGH TIME, UNTIL HERE AND NOW.

This is AN INVITATION TO COME PLAY, to create with your own hands little Womb Women in honour of your own matriarchal lineage … with hands that have been created from the DNA of all your ancestors before you.
As I sit and sculpt each woman, I become deeply aware that the bone and flesh of my own hands hold the DNA of all my grandmothers. How many of them had their own stories of shaping clay, forming sculptural figures, moulding pots .. what was it my grandmother of 200 thousand years ago created I wonder. 
Through the evolution of humanity, the hands of approximately 100 thousand womb to womb women of my unique bloodline have given birth to my own. Our shared DNA forms these hands which are now shaping clay.
Each one of us has our own special womb to womb lineage, with a unique tone particular only to us, perhaps similar to another, however no one female whakapapa is truly the same.  
Perhaps you will have a particular mother or grandmother in mind as you create, imbuing their passed down wisdom into the clay figurine, perhaps the little woman you make will symbolize your entire line, calling up the flavour of your own unique lineage, or perhaps she is you and represents your own story … or maybe she will hold for you the wisdom of the ancient mother that resides within us all. 
DO COME JOIN US for an afternoon of making your own little womb women.
NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED, simply bring a curiosity and willingness to play, surrounded by other humans doing just the same.
PRACTACALITIES,
bring a cushion and blanket (you may prefer to sit comfortably on the floor as you make - there will also be tables and chairs available)
if you are already familiar with clay and have your own favorite hand tools please feel free to bring these
snacks and hot/cold beverages will be available
Workshop cost includes supplies, materials and firing. I will fire your creation then post it back to you, therefore postage will be extra and determined once packaged up.
PLEASE NOTE!!! This booking is for FRIDAY 5TH SEPTEMBER
                                              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
“Within the DNA is written not only our histories as individuals but the whole history of the human race … patterns of DNA that have come down to us virtually unchanged from our distant ancestors – ancestors who are no longer just an abstract entity but real people who lived in conditions very different from those we enjoy today, who survived them and brought up their children.” ~ Bryan Sykes (The Seven Daughters of Eve)
Return to MAIN EXHIBITION WEBSITE - link coming soon

Want to learn the exact martial art skills as used in the Bourne films? Wellington this is your chance...

Tactical Survival Academy is hosting Senior Instructor Stephen Brown from the renowned Inosanto Academy of Martial Arts in Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles!

With over 40 years of martial arts experience and 36 years training under Guro Dan Inosanto, Stephen is one of only two instructors currently teaching Kali classes at the academy alongside Guro Dan Inosanto himself.

Stephen specializes in the Filipino Martial Art of Kali, as passed down through Guro Inosanto’s lineage. His training background also includes extensive experience in Muay Thai, Silat, Western Boxing, Jeet Kune Do, Savate and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

Over the decades, Stephen has worked with:
* Multiple branches of Law Enforcement, Military units and Special Forces.
* Actors, stunt performers, and executives in the film and television industry.
* As a fight choreographer for screen productions.

Known for his precision, adaptability, and deep respect for the cultural roots of the arts he teaches, Stephen brings a wealth of knowledge and embodied experience to every seminar.

Currently based in Marina Del Rey, CA, Stephen is excited to share the Kali method of Guro Inosanto with the New Zealand martial arts community.

description:
5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model, 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
The immediacy of the model’s presence encourages close observation and instinctive decision-making leading to work that is expressive and real. This hands-on interaction brings a sense of movement and authenticity that’s hard to achieve otherwise.

The sculpting process typically starts by analyzing the model’s proportions and pose. A wire armature is built to support the structure and clay is gradually applied to develop the form to a one-third life size 750mm tall figure. From there the artist refines the shapes focusing on anatomical accuracy and expressive detail that give the sculpture its final character.

With nearly 30 years of experience in traditional sculpture and the film industry Javier is not just a sculptor — he’s a mentor. Trained in classical techniques he studied fine arts and took anatomy courses at medical school developing a rare combination of artistic and anatomical knowledge. He spent over five years at the world-renowned Weta Workshop contributing to major films and exhibitions and has worked across materials scales and digital technologies.

Material is included in the price.
Armature is supplied during the workshop.
You can buy our tools during the workshop if you like.

description:
Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days, This two-day class will run on two Sundays, 24 and 31 August, 10am - 1pm. It is designed for advanced students and focuses on teaching a range of claw setting techniques, along with straightforward construction methods to securely hold gemstones of various shapes and sizes. The emphasis is on mastering the techniques rather than creating polished, finished jewellery pieces.
Students are encouraged to bring along their own particular tools, metal and stones if they would like to. They can also bring their own half made ring shanks or other projects to set into.
They will start by creating claw settings for flat-bottomed stones on plate to gain an understanding of how claws work.
Students will then move on to faceted stones and be shown how to construct their own settings in a number of styles, and how to secure their stones in settings. Finally, they will be taught the dos and don’ts of finishing settings to a salable level.
The workshop will also look at how to use pre-made claw settings to best advantage.
Workshop fee $245, Early bird $221 till 27 July.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Advanced Flush Setting in Two Days, Advanced Flush Setting in Two Days
This workshop is ideal for advanced students who have already learned how to set cabochon stones. Over two three-hour sessions, 20 and 27 September, 10am-1pm, you will be given an understanding of the technique of setting faceted stones using a setting burr, hammers, punches and burnishing tools. This is the first step in learning to flush set facet cut stones so they sit below the surface of the metal.

Session 1 will cover the technique, demonstrations and the basics of preparing and cutting the setting. Students will be shown how to set their stones, and may begin to do this in class, but will then go on to repeat and practice the technique in their own time.
They can do this at home, or for a small extra cost, can stay on at the studio to practice setting for the afternoon.

Session 2 will pick up on the setting techniques, reminding and refining essential steps in the process. Troubleshooting can be covered in this class, as well as learning to clean up the settings. The principles of this setting technique will be covered in a few different scenarios, as some students may wish to take this skill into different styles or directions.

The option for students to have a half-day bench hire after class will also apply to this session.

What is provided: class fees cover your practice metal (copper) and stones (CZ) and detailed handouts that are useful for you to take away to refer to when practising and honing your skills.

Correctly sized drills and setting burrs will be provided in class, but students must purchase their own burrs for practice after class and any future bench hires. These are available for purchase in the studio.

What to bring: Advanced students can bring projects to set stones into, but please note the metal must be at least 2mm thick and we do not allow brass to be used as a project or practice for beginners. The metal must be copper or sterling silver.

Students should bring either a craft magnifier or magnifying lenses/glasses. If you have your own flex shaft tool you plan to use at home for drilling and setting, please also bring this along so that your tutor can advise on the best way to use it. We have two drilling machines in the studio, and these must be shared between the students, so if you have a machine, do bring it.

Practice bench hire after class $20 per person (till 4pm) must be booked in advance.

Workshop fee $195, Early bird $175 till 24 August.

description:
Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography, Learn how to photograph the night sky with this three-part workshop.
Always wanted to capture the Milky Way but don't know where to start? Or you've tried and the results haven't been amazing?
We've designed this workshop for beginner astro photographers: to take you from zero astro knowledge to being able to capture at least one awesome astro photo to impress friends and family.
Wellington-based astro and landscape photographer Chris McKeown, and supported by Sony Advocate Rebecca McMillan, will guide you through what's required to plan, shoot, and process stunning images of the incredible night sky in Wellington.
We will start with an online introductory tutorial briefing on Sunday 17th August (evening), to discuss settings and camera gear, answer questions and confirm the meetup location for the Thursday evening workshop.
On Saturday 23 August we will meet from 7.30pm on Wellington's South Coast to capture the night sky. (A rain check date will be advised if required. The following evening we will host an online tutorial to demonstrate how to process your images, with time for Q&A.
We also have the opportunity to access Sony cameras for the workshop: please get in touch with the organisers at least two weeks ahead of the event if you would like to borrow gear for this workshop.
This is a ticketed workshop via Sony Scene.

description:
Bachata Beginners level 1, Welcome to Salsa Therapy! We have been running Bachata classes for over 10 years.
Ready to move, groove, and feel the rhythm?
Join our Complete Bachata Beginners Course and discover how Latin dancing can boost your confidence, improve posture, enhance coordination and movement — and help you recharge your mindset.
No experience needed — just bring your energy and love for music!
Learn all the fundamentals over 8 fun and engaging weeks
All levels of fitness welcome
Supportive, friendly vibes
Great way to move, connect, and feel AMAZING
Early Bird Special: Only $150 – limited time offer!
Secure your spot today and start your Bachata journey with us!
Payment Options:
1. If you would like to get the Early bird option bank transfer or cash at the door
Bank Transfer: Please transfer by AUG 1st 2025
Account: 011823-0012007-00
Name: Liliya de Castro
Reference: Your Name and T4B
Cash at the Door: Available on the day of the event
2. Order a regular term pass from our website (Dame Una)
We can't wait to meet you and help you master this beautiful and groovy dance called Bachata.

description:
Bakery & Brewery, Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Balfolk Class - Newtown, Balfolk Class - Newtown
Balfolk is a folk dance and music movement from Europe that gives new life to traditional dances. A ‘Bal Folk’ is a social dance event that brings people of all ages and walks of life together through group and partner dances to have fun and connect. It's a friendly, social and energising space.

The class will run over 6 weeks. We will learn and practice different group and partner dances you would commonly find in a Bal Folk.
Dances are simple and easy to learn but also have depth so once you have learnt the basics, we can explore and play around with variations.
Balfolk is accessible to people with all skill levels. You don’t need any previous dance experience, curiosity is all you need 😊

When: Wednesdays from 6:00 to 7:30pm

Location: Newtown Community Centre

Price: $60 for the block of 6 classes
$15/class for casual attendance
Students/concession/unwaged: koha

Also check out other Workshops in Wellington, Dance events in Wellington, Entertainment events in Wellington.

description:
Beginner Latte Art Class - Learn to Pour with The Hangar Crew, Learn how to pour beautiful latte art in this fun, hands-on beginner class with a skilled barista at The Hangar
Want to learn how to pour silky hearts and symmetrical tulips? Whether you're a coffee lover, a home barista, or just curious, this beginner Latte Art Class is for you!
Led by one of our skilled baristas at The Hangar, this hands-on workshop will take you through the fundamentals of milk steaming and latte art in clear, in-depth steps. You'll learn how to texture milk properly and pour a range of basic designs with confidence.
No experience needed
All equipment and milk provided
Hands-on, small group format
Date: Thursday, 4th of Sepember
Time: 17:00
Cost: $200 per person
Very limited spots, book now!
This class is beginner-friendly but packed with insight, perfect for anyone looking to build serious confidence on the steam wand and improve their latte art game.
Accessibility: The Hangar is wheelchair accessible and has gender-neutral bathrooms.

description:
Beginner jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Mondays - Wellington, Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. The block starts on Mon 25 August and runs for 8 weeks until Mon 13 October, 5.30pm - 8pm.
The stone setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project!
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Course fee $440, early bird $396 till 27 July.
Included in the class fee are a copper and brass pack for practising on, a sterling silver pack, 2 gemstones and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.

description:
Beginner's Knitting Class - Hataitai Community House, Beginner's Knitting Class - Hataitai Community House
Thank you for your interest in attending the 6-week Beginner's Knitting Class being run at Hataitai Community Centre.

In the workshop you will learn the basics of the craft of knitting.

Your facilitator will be Stella Peg Carruthers, a textile craft artist and eco-lifestylist who sees crafts as being a way to affect positive change in the world as a creative gesture against apathy.

Her practice is centered around sustainable materials re-use and slow creativity processes.

She is also interested in creating supportive community workshops that mirror the history of sewing in social spaces.

DATES: 27 September - 1 November 2025
TIME: Saturdays 2-4pm
PLACE: Hataitai Community House, 112 Waipapa Road, Hataitai

Basic materials will be provided including an initial pair of knitting needles and a ball of yarn to practice with. More detail about what to bring will come in an email closer to the date of the first workshop.

PLEASE NOTE: ALL ATTENDEES NEED TO REGISTER AND PAY USING THE GOOGLE FORM LINK BELOW:

description:
Best Practice Guidelines Workshop - Porirua, This interactive session will help you effectively manage volunteers at your organisation. The Volunteer Best Practice Guidelines provide a framework to consider and review your own practice, and learn from others.
The session includes insights into managing challenging behaviour and problem solving, and is aimed at novices right through to experts in volunteer management.
We will explore the practice areas:
Recruiting and engaging volunteers
Welcoming and onboarding volunteers
Volunteer support, leadership, and management
Train and grow volunteers
Feedback and recognition
Celebrate volunteer impact
Exiting Volunteers
We will be learning from everyone in the room, including you!
The workshop will be based on the Volunteering New Zealand's 'Best Practice Guidelines.' You can access these on our website here.
We will provide you morning tea and a light lunch. You'll be asked your dietary requirements when you register.
Registration is from 9:15am. Entry to venue from Pātaka Art + Museum.
What previous attendees have said:
"I just wanted to say thank you for the opportunity to attend that workshop. It was lovely talking to other people in the charity sector which I haven’t had the chance to do yet. Great discussions and ideas."
"I am very much enjoying your workshops, and have implemented some of the learnings already."

About your facilitator:
Alison Marshall is about helping others build capability through learning and development.
Ali has over 25 years’ experience in learning and development at a senior level. She has worked in a broad range of industries that includes oil and gas, professional services, retail, education and hospitality. She has worked for large global organisations, start-ups and government. Her talent is being able to build relationships across all levels of the organisation.
Alison Marshall

description:
Biochar Big Day Out 2025, Char curious? Keen gardener? Orchardist? Lifestyler? Climate Champion? BBQ enthusiast? 
Come one, come all to this one-off opportunity to spend a day making biochar in a magical orchard, forest and garden. Thank you Kapiti Coast District Council (KCDC) and Paekākāriki Orchards and Gardens (POG) for sponsoring this event so we can offer subsidised tickets as part of Sustainable Spring!
You will:

Morning sessions (9.30-12)...
Sipping coffee and learning the basics of Biochar. 
Getting hands-on exploring the property and learning to source good burn material (stuff you can find in your own backyard or lifestyle block).
Building a char toilet - great skills for civil defence emergencies, or just camping!
Ignite the Char-B-Que and BIG 600l kiln, learn how to feed the flames and trap the carbon.
Cooking using char!
At lunchtime (12-1)...
Enjoy a BBQ lunch cooked on the Char-B-Que. 
Learn all about the magic of biochar and how to use it to fight climate change, feed your garden. 
After lunch sessions (1-3)...
Quenching (pour cold water on) a kiln and processing char by drying and crushing it.
Making a home fireplace mini kiln using a biscuit tin (please bring a tin if you have one or koha for some extra we will source and bring from op shops).
Making a char water filter.
At the end of the day (3 pm)
Grab some biochar to take home (BYO container e.g. ice-cream tub or a small bucket
The big kiln will be quenched later in the day (around 4pm). For those keen to level up their learning on the kind of kilns used for large lifestyle blocks and small farms you are welcome to stay on and participate in a small advanced group dicussion and actvities between 3 and 4.30pm. 
Important things to note: 
Sustainability: 
We encourage carpooling to the event. Please bring your own reusable cup for hot drinks
Health and Safety:
 Please note there will be tree nuts and hazards onsite such as hot kilns and flames. So please take the necessary precautions by wearing non-flammable (cotton, wool, natural) materials and bring any personal medication that you need. We will have a health and safety volunteer onsite.

Family Friendly:
 It is a family-friendly event (kids under 18 are free) but they must be supervised by their parent or guardian at all times due to the hazards on site. 
Workshop Leaders 
John Wraight - CharPae 
Our CharPae Operations manager and ‘inhouse’ Biochar subject matter expert John Wraight has been making and using Biochar for many years and has delivered a number of successful workshops using these kilns. He is a BioChar Network member. He leads local CharPae burns, Char-B-Ques and kiln hire.
Holly Norton - CharPae 
Our CharPae Project manager has been making and using Biochar for the past 2 years. She co-leads these workshops and has additionally been exploring char use in sustainable construction and civil defence. She is currently on a mission to use Biochar to transform a tennis court into a thriving kai production space. She is this event's coordinator should you have any questions.

description:
Brazilian Zouk - Introduction to Tilted turns, Brazilian Zouk - Introduction to Tilted turns
Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block D (5 weeks).
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.

In Improvers Block D you will get an Introduction to Tilted turns as well as some exercises on Floor craft and the Social Dance experience.

- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukImpD
===Location:
Classes are in Studio 6, Level 5, Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street
===Housekeeping:
- You should have completed the 4 beginner Class blocks before joining Improvers classes
- Drop in or new students, please get in contact before the start of class to let us know you are interested so we can assess your level and organise a private class if necessary to catch you up. If you just show up on the night, you are welcome to watch the class but will not be able to join in (this is to respect the learning of our regular students as the classes are progressive)

description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block B, Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Io-Io
Week 4: Bonus
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25

description:
Breaker bay Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:
Breathe & Draw 'Where creativity meets inner peace', Breathe & Draw 'Where creativity meets inner peace'
Breathe & Draw
Where creativity meets inner peace


Saturday 27th of September
10:00 am - 11:30 am
@Hey Coastie 42 Tutere Street, Waikanae Beach


Join our (totally beginner-friendly) Breathe and Draw workshop. An art class focusing on drawing itself rather than the outcome of your work. This month's class is all about turning inner chaos into calm, visual order through mindful drawing. Starting with simple, spontaneous lines and adding as we go.

Why people do it:
Reduces stress and anxiety
Helps process emotions
Supports mindfulness

We start each class with some interactive drawing exercises before we start our final piece.
$25 fee, includes all supplies.
We meet at Hey Coasties at Waikanae Beach by the Banana trees. We will be in the outdoor area if the weather is fine, please bring a jacket just in case.
Spots are limited, please get in touch to book in advance.

Also check out other Workshops in Waikanae, Arts events in Waikanae, Fine Arts events in Waikanae.

description:
CHEERS DAD!, Come along for an afternoon creative session of painting a piece of pottery for Dad - or with Dad, whilst sipping on your choice of brew.
This is your opportunity to get sorted for Father's Day (Father's Day NZ is Sun 7th September).
Book a ticket for yourself, your family and your dad, enjoy a creative session altogether, each turning a mug or tumbler into work of Picasso. No family dramas just a fun old time.
If Dad can't make it, make him a custom gift. Bring along your partner or your beer loving bestie!
You will be guided through the process of painting (let's get our facts straight its actually underglaze not paint!) your Mug/Tumbler. Dad will treasure his custom made piece or you could make matching family mugs!
This Pottery painting workshop is absolutely suitable for anyone...even the least creative people!
Ticket price includes:




Your own ceramic Mug/Tumbler ready for decorating


One Beverage (Beer or non alcoholic)


All the materials needed


Guidance from me to create a piece Dad will treasure forever


1 Kiln firing ~ this makes the piece strong, shiny and food and drink safe

description:
Calligratherapy - Beginners, Calligratherapy combines science journalist James Nestor's theory on proper breathing with the philosophy of ancient Chinese calligraphy to promote a state of optimal wellbeing. Over five weeks, you will develop and practice the awareness of healthy breathing while learning new techniques of Chinese soft brush calligraphy covering five different scripts.

Description
Many of us live sedentary lifestyles, sitting for up to eight hours or more a day hunched over our keyboard - all the while rarely taking a proper breath! Even if we wanted to take a deep enriching breath into the lower lobes of our lungs, we are limited due to our posture. Often due to the stresses and strains of a busy work and life balance, our unconscious brain can develop a pattern of holding, irregular and shadow breaths.

Does this sound like your experience?

Not being able to breathe properly is the key cause of many chronic respiratory diseases (Nestor, 2020)

Calligratherapy combines science journalist James Nestor's theory on proper breathing with the philosophy of ancient Chinese calligraphy to promote a state of optimal wellbeing.

Calligratherapy has been developed specifically for those who have never practiced calligraphy before and who are interested in deriving the benefits without having to learn the language or all the characters. It integrates the simple and intuitive act of inhaling and exhaling into calligraphy practice with Eastern philosophy behind it.

A range of different breathing exercises are embedded into each 90-minute session focusing on different calligraphy scripts. Over the five weeks, you will develop and practice the awareness of healthy breathing, while learning new techniques of Chinese soft brush calligraphy covering five different scripts.

All materials included in course fee.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

Start a new creative practice in Chinese soft brush calligraphy
Develop your own mindfulness strategy
Better manage everyday stress levels and access a calm, empowered and positive state of mind
Find ways to explore eastern philosophy and develop deeper connections with your spiritual self.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".


Duration 5 weeks, Thu 5:30 PM – 7:00 PM

description:
Chain Maille Course, Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.

This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.

Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.

There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.

Course Outline:
Week 01 - 18th September
101: Basic Skills and Discovery
At this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.
Opening & closing rings properly
Trying out some simple structures
Begin exploring material options and how to make your own rings
Homework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille

Week 02 - 25th September
Play and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projects
Playing with recycled & foraged materials
Homework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class

Week 03 - 2nd October
Mathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.
Math of designing chain maille
Theory & pre-planning
Discussion about ideas for individual projects
Identify materials needed to execute individual designs
Homework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.

Week 04 - 16th October
By this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.

Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th October
These classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.

Week 07 - 6th November
At this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.

description:
Chess - Learn to Play, Chess – Learn to Play
Starting from the beginning you will discover how to play the 3000-year-old game of Chess. You will learn the principles that guide decision making in all parts of the game, learn algebraic notation and the ability to not only play a game anywhere, anytime, but also knowledge of where and how to play - both online and in person.

Description
Chess is an ancient game of strategy and analysis that hones concentration and focus, as you master the skills allowing you to win at this competitive recreation.

Join tutor, Ryan Hill to learn how to play this game from the beginning.

You will quickly go from understanding the basics to being able to engage in playing confidently and discover where to go for further training or to carry on playing – both in person and online.

Over 600 million people play this game that has remained popular throughout the ages – why don’t you become one of them!

Bring pen and paper to take notes.

By the end of this course you will be able to:

*Be able to use all of the chess pieces to play the game
*Be able to recount and use some of the most common openings and traps
*Recognise where to go for further training or to play
*Develop increasing levels of confidence in your ability to play and possibly win

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Clay Creations: Incense Holders, Clay Creations: Incense Holders
Settle in for a cosy evening of creativity, good company, and delicious food.
In this hands-on workshop, everyone will be guided step-by-step to make their own incense holder from air-dry clay — no pottery wheel or kiln needed. The design inspiration for the night will be a dreamy moon-and-stars theme, but there’s plenty of room for personal flair. Those who love to freestyle can create their own unique style, while those who prefer a little direction can simply follow along and enjoy the process.
It’s an easy-going, beginner-friendly space where conversations flow, laughter is encouraged, and there’s something grounding about feeling clay in your hands. It’s a chance to step away from the usual routine, relax into a slower pace, and take joy in making something from scratch.
After the crafting is done, the evening continues with a beautiful plant-based dinner and dessert shared together — wholesome food to round out a wholesome night. Everyone will head home with their own handmade incense holder, a full belly, and that cozy, satisfied feeling that comes from a night spent creating and connecting.

Cooking - More Tastes of Vietnamese Street Food, Description
Come along and learn how to create wonderful Vietnamese dishes bursting with fresh flavours.

Depending on what's seasonally available, dishes taught may include some of the following: green papaya prawn salad (Nộm tôm đu đủ xanh), lemongrass chicken stir fry with steamed rice (Cơm Gà rang sả) , grilled pork noodle and fried rolls (bún nem thịt nướng) and beef noodle soup (Phở bò).

All ingredients provided but bring an apron, dish cloth, tea towels and containers to take food home.

Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

description:
Cooking Classes, Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
Please contact for booking: indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

So just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

description:
Creative Futures: Arts, Economy and System Shifts, Join celebrated artist and cultural leader Teremoana Rapley MNZM for a powerful wānanga exploring the role of creativity in shaping local economies and systems. From local identity and wellbeing to economic growth and policy influence, this workshop invites artists, community leaders, and changemakers to reimagine the power of the arts in our region.
Through kōrero and shared storytelling, we’ll unpack how artistic practice can drive systems change and strengthen Lower Hutt's inclusive, culturally rich creative economy, one that reflects indigenous and local voices of communities across Te Awa Kairangi.
Teremoana Rapley MNZM is a pioneering artist, broadcaster, and cultural leader whose work spans music, television, and indigenous creative advocacy. Of Kiribati, Rarotonga, Aitutaki, Mangaia, Cuba, Jamaica, and Suriname descent, she first rose to prominence with Upper Hutt Posse and Moana & the Moahunters. Her practice is rooted in indigenous storytelling, systems change, and mentoring, often acting as a “Matriarchitect” to uplift others. With accolades including the Pacific Music Awards Lifetime Achievement Award and induction into the Aotearoa Music Hall of Fame, Rapley continues to shape Aotearoa’s creative landscape through collaboration, education, and community engagement.
In partnership with Toi Rauwhārangi College of Creative Arts, Massey University.
Light refreshments provided.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Crochet for Calmness, Crochet is great for settling the mind and encouraging relaxation. Learn to do basic stitches, read patterns and complete projects in a relaxed and friendly space – left handers very welcome.

The repetitive movements of crochet help the brain make more serotonin, which can decrease tension and feelings of depression. We’ll move through all the steps from the starting slipknot to reading patterns and diagrams and making your first crochet projects.

You’ll learn to make a granny square, change colours and how to increase and decrease. You’ll also find out more about the notations and abbreviations of crochet stitches so you can make those awesome crochet projects you've been waiting to make!

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Discuss the benefits of crochet for relaxation and alleviation of mood
- Read a basic crochet pattern and recognise crochet terminology
- Choose yarns and hooks for projects
- Use a range of stitches with confidence
- Complete at least one project of your choice (granny square, keychain, garden decoration)

Suitable for all beginners, both left and right-handers and those who may have struggled to learn to crochet. Initial materials provided but bring along any yarn or crochet hooks you may have at home (don’t buy anything until you’ve discussed this with the tutor).

4 weeks, Thu 5:30-7:30pm
Wellington High School
Presented by Monique Lubberink
$129 incl. GST

description:
Drawing & Painting - Creative Arts Holiday Programme for Tween & Teens, Join us for a fun beginner friendly workshop for keen young artists interested in drawing and painting.

Over two sessions, tutor Jake Fairweather will lead participants through a series of exercises designed help improve your drawing and painting.

Workshop goals include:
- Identify the key aspects of a scene to focus on
- How to hatch in various ways to describe the form and express different feelings
- How to tell a story through composition and colour
- How to push the story even further by modifying the lighting and shadows
- Discover your personal drawing and painting style
- Develop greater proficiency with graphite pencil and acrylic paint

Tuesday and Wednesday, 23 & 24 September, 10 am - 1 pm daily.
Suitable for ages 10 and above.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, animation, sewing and pottery head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
ESC September Asian Artist meetup, The Eastern Sound Collective is a growing community of creatives with pan-Asian roots, coming together to connect, collaborate, and support each other.
We’d love for you to join us for our next gathering on Thursday, September 4th at 6.30PM!
The evening will kick off with a workshop on Building Sustainable Art Practices with Jem Yoshioka:
About Jem:
Jem Yoshioka is an illustrator, writer and comic artist based in Pōneke, Wellington. Jem's debut graphic novel Folk Remedy Book 1 releases in September 2025, and she's busy working on Book 2. When not making comics you can find Jem dreaming up more story ideas and hanging out with her black cat. You can find her on social media @jemyoshioka most places (Instagram, BlueSky, TikTok, X)
Building Sustainable Art Practices:
In 2025 it feels like it's challenging enough to survive as a person, let alone thrive as an artist. But art has the unique power to nourish us in ways nothing else can. In this workshop Jem will share some of the strategies, habits and tools she uses to fit in making graphic novels alongside full time employment without burning out. This session is practice-agnostic, and is designed to facilitate discussion about what a sustainable art practice can look like, how to build one, and how we can support each other when things are tough. No resources required but feel free to bring any notebooks or tools you use to manage your art or your time

After that, we’ll share some kai (potluck style), have a relaxed kōrero
The gathering will be held at a cozy private space in Wellington CBD, easily accessible by public transport.
Message us for the exact location: easternsoundcollective@gmail.com
Or reach out on Instagram/Facebook: @easternsoundcollective
