description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt, Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt

If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.

In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will discover:

What stops you from saying "no" when you really want to

How to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"

How to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict

Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. description:
Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington, Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington
For practices,clinics & care teams ready to adopt Heidi—the AI scribe for all clinicians. Join us in Wellington. Hosted by Hendrix Health.

About this Event



Experience the Future of Clinical Documentation with Heidi & Hendrix
This event is perfect for practices and clinics looking to bring —the AI medical scribe for all clinicians—into their organisation. Heidi can be used by doctors, nurses, pharmacists, physios, psychologists, vetenarians and more, supporting everything from patient consults and shift handovers to practice meetings and MDMs.
Built with robust data privacy and compliance in mind, Heidi scales to fit how your clinic operates, so you can spend less time on paperwork and more time on patient care. We’ll also discuss safe AI adoption in healthcare, including how Heidi respects data sovereignty in Aotearoa. This session is designed to be straightforward and practical—no hype, just a real look at how AI can transform your everyday workflow.

About Heidi is an AI-powered medical scribe designed to ease the documentation load on clinicians. Already supporting over a million patient interactions every week, Heidi transcribes and processes clinical conversations in real time—helping generate notes, letters, and assessments so clinicians can spend more time with patients and less on paperwork.
Built by a team of doctors and backed by leading global investors, Heidi has become a trusted partner for practices and clinics around the world. The technology is developed to meet international standards including HIPAA, GDPR, NHS and the Australian Privacy Principles, with enterprise-grade certifications like SOC2 and ISO27001.
Heidi never stores session recordings and does not sell or share clinical data. It's designed with clinician wellbeing, patient care, and data safety at its core. Learn more at heidihealth.com.

About
Hendrix Health, Heidi’s official partner in Aotearoa New Zealand , is dedicated to transforming healthcare through life-long learning and human-centred technology. Since September 2024, the Hendrix team have visited over 120 GP clinics, 10 hauora Māori, and 6 Pasifika providers to understand the real challenges on the ground. By working closely with local communities, Hendrix Health ensures that revolutionary innovations like Heidi are culturally responsive and truly effective—already changing the lives of 1000's of healthcare professionals across the country.


Agenda


🕑: 05:00 PM - 06:00 PM
Networking on Arrival (Whakawhanaungatanga)
Info: Arrive, grab a drink, some kai, and connect with fellow attendees. This is your chance to meet new faces, catch up with colleagues, and set a welcoming tone for the evening.


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:10 PM
Opening Karakia & Whakatauki
Info: We’ll open with a brief karakia (blessing) to acknowledge our gathering, focus our intentions, and bring everyone together under a shared purpose. A short whakatauki will be shared, reminding us why we’re here: to improve healthcare for all in Aotearoa.



🕑: 06:10 PM - 06:15 PM
Current Pressues in your Work
Info: A quick reflection on everyday challenges—like documentation fatigue, paperwork overload, and time inefficiencies—that impact both workflow and patient care.



🕑: 06:15 PM - 06:30 PM
Heidi Demo
Info: We’ll show how Heidi fits into your clinical workflow, covering:


- Who is Heidi? Background and purpose.


- AI Scribing Basics: Four steps (Transcribe, Customise, Output, Review).


- Live Demo: A clinician–patient consultation, including informed consent and template use.


- SOAP Formatting & Note Review: How Heidi helps structure and refine notes.


- Ask Heidi Anything: See how to generate a patient letter or other documents directly from the consultation.


🕑: 06:30 PM - 06:40 PM
Principles of Safe AI Use in Healthcare/Data Handling
Info: Explore data privacy, sovereignty, and compliance in Aotearoa, plus best practices for responsibly adopting AI in clinical settings.


🕑: 06:40 PM - 06:45 PM
Karakia Whakamutunga
Info: We’ll close the formal session with a karakia, acknowledging the time shared and the insights gained.


🕑: 06:45 PM - 08:00 PM
Networking
Info: Continue conversations, ask further questions, and connect with the team. Wrap up the evening with new insights and meaningful connections.



Also check out other Health & Wellness events in Wellington, Meetups in Wellington.

description:
Exploring our Shared Humanity, Do you ever feel that you're just going through the motions? That life is a series of tasks, a pursuit of pleasure, or a race for self-improvement that never really satisfies? This isn't just a feeling; it's a fundamental human question about what it means to exist.

Description
Join experienced psychotherapist Rohit Grover for a six-week course that invites you to look beyond the surface of everyday life. In these two-hour sessions, we will explore the core tenets of existential therapy, moving away from the conventional focus on self and hedonism. Instead, we'll grapple with life's big questions:

What does it truly mean to live a value-driven life?
Do our personal values matter, or is the search for meaning just an illusion?
What is the "being" part of "human being" all about?

Through guided discussions, reflective exercises, and insights from classic existential thinkers, Rohit will help you navigate this profound territory. This isn't about finding easy answers. It's about developing the courage to ask the right questions, to confront the realities of freedom, responsibility, and meaning, and to discover a more authentic way of living.

This course is for anyone ready to step off the treadmill and begin a deeper exploration of what it means to be alive. Come and find out what it means to truly exist

Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:

Differentiate between a life driven by external pressures or fleeting pleasures and one rooted in personal values and authentic meaning.

Identify and critically examine the core existential givens of human existence, such as freedom, responsibility, isolation, and the search for meaning.

Articulate a personal understanding of what it means to "be" a human being, moving beyond a purely functional or biological definition.

Arrive at sensing rather than thinking. Sensing this existence, this dance of life. Widen your view of existence.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
From Sad Blokes to Well Men: Changing the focus in male suicide prevention - Wellington (FSB2025/01), From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan.
Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2025? How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.

IT'S TIME FOR A SERIOUS RETHINK IN HOW WE PREVENT MALE SUICIDE AND TO TAKE SUICIDE IN MEN OUT OF THE TOO HARD BASKET
Hear a comprehensive critique of why the suicide rate in men continues to rise despite numerous prevention initiatives, the reasons why we need to focus more on men and what are proven effective strategies for preventing male suicide.
BE PART OF THE SOLUTION
DURING THE MONTH OF MOVEMBER TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE  IN A WORKSHOP WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MALE SUICIDE PREVENTION SPECIALIST BARRY TAYLOR
It matters that men are able to optimise their wellbeing.  Well men contribute to well whānau, communities, workplaces, economy and society
Drawing on his lived experience and his extensive experience in engaging, assessing and supporting suicidal men of different cultures, age groups, genders and sexualities, he offers practical and time proven approaches to both preventing male suicide, engaging with a suicidal man and effective initiatives to optimise men's wellbeing.
"Helping men and boys to transition from sad blokes to well men must be our focus"
Topics covered:
Overview of suicide in men
The Suicidal Moment - Men's thoughts, emotions and behaviour in the "suicidal moment”
Masculinity for the 21st Century - Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2024?  How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
Intergenerational suicide among men and its impact of whānau and hapū
From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.
Tāne Ora: An Online Masterclass in creating a movement of wellbeing for men by men
Participants would benefit from also registering for this online workshop series which takes a deep dive into the determinants of wellbeing men and what is required to shift very ingrained understandings in men about being a man.  How do we move from a program approach to mens wellbeing to a movement of change that engages men in conversations of the heart and the walrua. Click here for more information and to register
Previous participants’ feedback
"The best and most informative workshop I have attended in 27 years of mental health nursing”  Community Mental Health Nurse
"This workshop should be compulsory for anyone working with men”  Male Family Violence Worker
"It was as if Barry was talking about every young man I see at school”  School Counsellor
"I have much better understanding about depressed and suicidal men. Going away with lots of ideas of how work with the men in my community”  Rural Community Support Worker
"Thanks for being so inclusive of older men. They are so often forgotten”. Aged Care Worker
"The incorporation of Te Ao Māori into the training was excellent and made it relevant to the men I work with” Kaiwhakatere
"Most helpful workshop I have been to in regards to suicide”  Mental Health Recovery Programme Facilitator
"Appreciated how inclusive the presenter was of different cultures and his analysis of how culture influences what it means to be a man”  Refugee Health Worker
An opportunity for a day of learning with award winning suicidologist, Barry Taylor

Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention / postvention for 36 years at the local, national and international levels.
His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to and evaluating  community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programmes.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in the context of suicide prevention and postvention both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas. In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award. He currently sits one of the Health and Disability Ethics Committees.
As a health sociologist, Barry offers an unique insight into the phenomenon of male suicide in the Aotearoa-New Zealand context, the role of gender construction and the critical social and cultural determinants that have influenced men's distress and impaired wellbeing. Insights that very few others trainers or training programs in this country provide. He has had an interest on the impact of social exclusion, alienation and discrimination on mens's wellbeing and advocates for a human rights based, systems change and person-centred approach to wellbeing.The workshop is enriched by the learnings from Barry's own lived experience of depression and suicidality and his pathway to recovery.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to effectively respond to the unacceptably high rate of male suicide in this country.

WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 30% discount off each registration
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay) 
Invoice - Organisations can request to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
Payment by Invoice is only for NGOs, Government Departments, Te Whatu Ora, PHOs, Schools and tertiary organisations, businesses.
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $45+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

description:
Gong Bath at Newtown Community Centre, ***$20***
Limited door sales for $25
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth*
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and frequencies of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.
**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 20 PEOPLE ONLY**
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time, Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!
6.15pm Tuesday 26th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Wellington, We're pleased to invite you to join us for this workshop on Building resilience and unlocking the power of the mind.
Why this matters:
In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill. It's not just about bouncing back from adversity but confidently navigating change. Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability. This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind. By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
What to expect:
During this interactive workshop, participants will explore the core concepts of resilience and the mind-body connection through engaging discussions, experiential exercises, and practical demonstrations. They will learn evidence-based techniques to enhance their resilience, manage stress effectively, and cultivate a positive mindset amidst adversity. By the end of the session, attendees will emerge with a comprehensive toolkit to fortify their mental resilience and embrace change with confidence.
Who this is for:
This workshop caters to individuals across all organisational levels who are eager to enhance their resilience and cultivate a resilient mindset. Whether you're an owner, manager, chef, senior staff member, or junior employee, this workshop offers invaluable insights and practical strategies to bolster resilience and thrive in today's fast-paced world.
About the presenter, Sarah Robb
Sarah is a certified coach, counselor, and Master Practitioner of NLP (neuro-linguistic programming) holding a Bachelor's degree in Psychology.
With a passion for transformation, she guides individuals through retraining their brains and breaking free from limiting beliefs and patterns. Drawing on her extensive lived experience, Sarah has collaborated with over 200 clients and organisations, empowering them to apply practical tools and strategies for significant improvements in their mental health.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

Hormones, Hunger & Home Loans, Hormones, Hunger & Home Loans

description:
Humans: Why & What To Do, Humans: Why & What To Do
An evening of inspiration & indulgence! Talk by Devamrita Swami followed by a plant-powered dinner & dessert.

We’re the most connected generation in history — and somehow the loneliest. We’ve built more technology than any civilisation before us — and still can’t solve our basic problems. We talk endlessly about progress — while the planet burns and mental health plummets.

What if the trouble isn’t just what we’re doing… but that we’ve forgotten why we’re doing it?

In this bold talk, Devamrita Swami — a world-traveling monk, strategist, and social critic — unpacks the mess we’re in and asks the questions most of us avoid: Why are we here? And what should we actually be doing about it?

Afterwards, stick around for a plant-based dinner and dessert — fresh, colourful, and made to share. Grab a plate, grab a seat, and dive into real conversations with people who are curious, open-minded, and up for something different.

Meet Devamrita Swami, your host
Devamrita Swami is an educator, author, and monk who has spent over forty years exploring and sharing the wisdom of bhakti-yoga. He brings ancient Vedic teachings to life, effortlessly navigating the latest research in archaeology, consciousness, ancient history, neuroscience, social science, and psychology. Author of Searching for Vedic India and Hiding in Unnatural Happiness, he combines philosophy with practical insights on happiness, wellbeing, and personal fulfillment. For anyone seeking to channel the human drive for fulfilment in a meaningful and sustainable way, Devamrita Swami offers clear, engaging, and indispensable wisdom.

description:
Inner infrastructure for Outer Resilience, In times of polycrisis and uncertainty, more people are coming around to the need not for more information, but for integration and presence.
This 90-minute session offers a safe, grounded space to slow down, reconnect with ourselves, and explore the inner terrain of change-making, and of our relational space.
As Rumi reminds us: “Yesterday I was clever and tried to change the world; today I am wise and am changing myself.”
Building our inner infrastructure - our relationship with self, with our feelings, with others and with nature - is foundational to how we show up in the world.
We will begin by discussing research into how distraction or numbing our discomfort is an intelligent and common short-term survival strategy, but in fact is one which limits our long-term capacity to connect, lead and evolve. We will then guide participants in somatic practices to offer accessible ways to reconnect with your agency.
During this session, you will gain tools to increase your inner awareness, expand your bandwidth of awareness, and integrate emotion, sensation, and story. Together we’ll explore the role of perception in our orientation to life and the choices we make, how our narratives can connect us with our agency, the power of curiosity, and dive into how our relational presence can often have more impact than our opinions.
This session is an invitation to restore connection, calm, and courage, to become more whole, more fully human, and more ready for what this moment is asking of us.
About your host
Freda is a curator, engagement practitioner, and connector, who works at the intersection of social change, community-building, and inner development. She is the Founder of the Goodlife Collective, which curates spaces that build connection, wellbeing and collective wisdom.
Drawing on yoga teaching, somatic practices and adult development, Freda is interested in how we build our inner infrastructure - the capacity to work through discomfort, reconnect with our agency, and bring greater presence to relationships. Her background is in psychology, environmental-science and design, and she loves nerding out on ideas and conversations about unlocking our collective potential.

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are monthly on the second Friday of each month and are held temporarily in the Meeting Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. LIFE DRAWING MEETS YOGA!, LIFE DRAWING MEETS YOGA!
Connect with your body and your creativity in this all-levels workshop that combines vinyasa yoga practice with a fun and interactive Life Drawing class!

The Life Drawing session is based on the teaching methods of Cecil Collins, a British artist whose non-academic approach to drawing challenges you to leave your inhibitions at the door and work freely from your creative centre...much like yoga!

“But I can’t draw!,” you say. Then even better! This approach is perfect for the artist and non-artist alike as it asks you to drop your expectations of what art should look like, inviting you to express the pose from within…just like we do in yoga.

Drinks & nibbles follow, along with a chance for kōrero and connection.

Guided by JoElle Gragilla from South Coast Studio in Island Bay, who studied Cecil’s methods in London and is an artist, art teacher and AWHI-trained yoga teacher. Co-facilitated by AWHI's Lachlan Broughton.

Investment: $75 (includes yoga class, mat & props, art materials, art lesson, herbal tea throughout and drinks & nibbles at the end!)

We've done this workshop before so can confidently say it's a REALLY FUN TIME! Definitely don't miss out!

If you’ve been through a redundancy, restructure, or a big shift in your working life - or if you’ve been out of work for a while and are looking ahead to something new - this gathering is for you.
We’ll spend an hour outdoors (weather permitting) in a gentle, guided ritual to help you release some of the heaviness that comes with change and open up to what’s next. You can expect moments of quiet reflection, light movement, and simple nature-based activities designed to connect you with yourself, the land, and a sense of possibility. There’s no chanting, costumes, or anything too out-there - just a safe, thoughtful space to mark what you’ve been through and welcome in the next chapter.
The ritual will be hosted by Tamara Buckland - Leadership Strategist, Chief People Officer, and Druid - who blends leadership wisdom with nature-based practices to create meaningful, accessible experiences for people in transition.
After the ritual, we’ll wander to Picnic Café for coffee or tea (you’ll just need to cover your own drink) for those who’d like to keep connecting.
Details
📅 Friday 29 August (rain date: Friday 5 September)
🕛 12:00–1:00pm ritual
☕ 1:00pm coffee/tea at Picnic Café
💸 Free (pay for your own drink at the café)

description:
Master Your Mornings: A Routine That Works, Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works
Take charge of your mornings and set yourself up for a productive, goal-driven day. A well-designed morning routine can give you focus, fuel your ambition, and create momentum that carries through everything you do. In this workshop, you’ll learn how to build a routine that fits your life and drives your success.

Dive into the science behind effective morning habits, pick up practical strategies for building routines that stick, and explore proven techniques to stay motivated and on track. Whether your goal is to enhance productivity, improve wellbeing, or cultivate mindfulness, this workshop gives you the tools to turn your mornings into a launchpad for long-term achievements.

What you’ll gain:

Understand the psychology behind morning habits and why they matter

Discover how to design a morning routine tailored to your personal and professional aspirations

Learn time-tested strategies for consistency and maintaining motivation

Build a morning routine that sets you up for success, every single day

Leave this workshop with a clear, actionable morning routine that empowers you to take control of your day, and more importantly, your future.

Start each day with intention, clarity, and the momentum to reach your goals

Meet Nava, your host

Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After eight exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

Your mind is a powerful place — but sometimes it feels like it’s running the show. In this engaging evening with Chaitanya Charan, a monk and internationally acclaimed speaker, you’ll discover practical tools to quiet mental noise, sharpen focus, and make clear, confident choices. Set in our welcoming and creative space, this event blends inspiration with connection. After the talk, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert — a perfect chance to unwind, reflect, and connect with like-minded people over great food.

Meet Chaitanya Charan, your host

He has spoken in more than 30 countries, from Ivy League universities to grassroots gatherings, engaging audiences with his clear thinking, relatable stories, and practical strategies. An accomplished author and speaker, Chaitanya Charan offers insights that challenge perspectives, spark reflection, and inspire real change.

description:
Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection, Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection
Men’s Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection

In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

This is a free event, with an optional plant-based dinner available for $15. While there’s no obligation to stay for dinner, sharing a meal together offers a meaningful way to strengthen connections. Andre and Sri Jiva co-host this circle with a shared passion for creating authentic, supportive spaces where men can connect deeply—offering this gathering simply because they believe in its importance.

The Men’s Circle provides a safe and nurturing environment where men can share openly, express their feelings, and encourage personal growth—free from societal pressures to be stoic or self-reliant. Through honest sharing and collective support, participants build resilience, deepen self-awareness, and strengthen their sense of identity and purpose.

Structure of the Circle

Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.

A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.

Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the person holding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.

Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is optional, and passing is always respected.

Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking, interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.

No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicited advice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.

Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.

Circle Agreements

Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fostering trust and brotherhood.

Focus on the Present: Share what's alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.

Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements to promote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."

No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicited advice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.

Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others' details private.

Meet Andre and Sri Jiva, your hosts

Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.

description:
Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection, Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
The Men’s Circle is a free, supportive gathering for men to connect, share openly, and grow together. Whether you're navigating life changes, seeking community, or simply wanting a space to be heard, you're welcome here.
Expect honest conversations and the kind of connection that’s rare but necessary. No pressure to speak—just your presence is enough. We follow a respectful, non-judgmental format that prioritizes safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
Stay afterwards for a nourishing, plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a powerful way to extend the connection beyond the circle. This gathering is not run for profit—Andre is simply passionate about creating spaces for genuine connection.
What to Expect in the Circle:
Gathering in Circle: We sit in a circle to foster a sense of unity and equality.
Centering In: A short meditation or silence helps us arrive and ground.
Talking Object: A shared object moves around—only the person holding it speaks.
Optional Sharing: Speak if you feel moved. You’re always welcome to pass.
Active Listening: No interruptions, advice, or feedback—just presence.
Confidentiality: What's shared in the circle, stays in the circle.
Our Shared Agreements:
Speak from the “I”: Share from your own experience, not on behalf of others.
No fixing or judging: This is not a space to solve, but to witness.
Be present: Share what’s alive for you right now.
Respect and trust: We uphold a culture of care, confidentiality, and non-judgment.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 7 Oct, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.


Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Kapiti Coast to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.


So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want.

description:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind, Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point? This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction. Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.


Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 19th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets

description:
Real Talk Kāpiti, Real Talk Kāpiti
We are excited to announce that we are bringing Real Talk to Kāpiti. We can’t wait to share space with you all!
🔥Saturday 29th November
🔥11am to 3pm (doors open at 10.30am)
🔥Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,
Kapiti College, Paraparaumu

This is a FREE event for Rangatahi (14-25years) and also FREE for Rangatahi Service Providers, Kaiako, anyone that works with our rangatahi, Tāngata whaikaha and whaiora.
Click here to register for your tickets:
https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2025/real-talk-kapiti/paraparaumu

Real Talk Kōrero

We take our audience on a journey, a journey of laughter, a journey of tears, and a journey with absolute passion and purpose.
We create a safe space to speak about what we have experienced in our lives, and that we don’t have to be whakamā, we don’t have to live in silence, we don’t have to hide our secrets anymore.
Because when we speak – we heal, when we speak we free ourselves, and when we speak – we provide inspiration and hope for others.

We provide the following at each event:

❤️Inspiring kaikōrero
❤️Free kai and refreshments
❤️Opportunity to win some incredible prizes on the day
❤️FREE Real Talk pukapuka for every rangatahi in the audience

The subjects covered in our kōrero start with but are not limited to the subjects listed below:

⚫️Suicide and triggers and coping mechanisms
⚫️Mental Health awareness
⚫️Sexual, physical abuse and domestic violence
⚫️Being raised in gang affiliated environments
⚫️Drug and alcohol addiction
⚫️Teen pregnancy & pregnancy loss
⚫️Death & grief
⚫️Takatāpui & tangata whaikaha
⚫️Discrimination – racial, gender, sexual orientation
⚫️Relationship breakdowns
⚫️Career & business aspirations
⚫️Standing strong in who you are

We have a great line up of powerhouse, inspirational kaikōrero/speakers on the day:
🔥Pairama Wright – TikTok sensation

description:
Return to Love - Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine (Group Shamanic Journeying), Return to Love - Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine (Group Shamanic Journeying)
✨Return to Love – A Shamanic Journey of Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine

Relationships are some of our greatest teachers. Whether you are single or partnered, whether your past experiences were harmonious or painful, each relationship reflects the inner dance of the masculine and feminine within us.

Throughout history, these sacred energies—Yin and Yang—were meant to complement and support each other. Yet, distortions, suppression, and separation have created wounds that echo through generations. Many of us carry beliefs such as:

Men cannot be trusted.
Women are not safe.
Love must be earned.
......

Rarely do we pause to sit with these wounds and meet the unhealed parts of our inner feminine and masculine. These energies may hold not only personal pain but also ancestral imprints passed down through time—shaping the way we experience love and connection today.

🌿 In this mini workshop, you will be guided through a shamanic journey to explore and heal your inner archetypes. Together, we will:

✨ Release old wounds and limiting patterns carried by the inner feminine or masculine.
✨ Make peace with the shadow side of our psyche.
✨ Embody the wholeness of the Divine Masculine and Feminine within.

We will close our circle with a sacred forgiveness ritual, bridging the separation and returning to a state of balance, wholeness, and love.

This journey is open to everyone—whether you are new to shamanic work or have walked this path before. All that is required is an open heart and willingness to connect deeply within.

🌸 You’ll leave with:

A renewed sense of love and harmony within yourself.
Greater balance between your inner masculine and feminine.
A deeper connection to spirit, self, and the essence of oneness.

Event Details
📅 Sunday, September 21st
🕒 3:00–6:00 pm
📍 Lotus Yoga Centre – Sanctuary, Paraparaumu
💫 Energy Exchange: $55 per person
🌿 Limited to 12 participants

✨What to bring:
A water bottle, journal, cushion or blanket for comfort.

🚗 Rides from Wellington may be arranged—please contact me if needed.Contact: 0272541272

About Your Guide - Fery Qiu

I am a Shamanic Healer who is committed to the healing path that help people heal from the core of their being. From suicidal depression to shamanic path, my spirituality is not based on how many trainings, meditations, and ceremonies I have done, it’s coming from a deep embodied experience to transform pain into wisdom and empowerment. The shamanic path is a way of being; we allow ourselves to go deeper within to connect all things that come from oneness. I loved my work, which has been proven to help people really change their lives. If you are curious about what this mini workshop could bring, having an open mind and open heart, you will be surprised by how much can be done just in this brief journey within.



With love,
Fery Qiu

Decompress the Vagus Nerve, release trauma (any adaptive response to change, stresses the nervous system) deprogram the PSOA, access your inner fire, creative expression, voice, and power, through holistic movements, breath work, and bioenergetic movement.
 4 Sunday weekly group sessions 1.5 hrs -  Starting Sunday 21st of  September 2025  for 4 Sundays  at 4:30pm-6pm

you can also bring cash on the day but commit to all sessions please.

Unlocking inner body technology through breath, trembling, movement, and subtle holistic dance and mudras (activation or access codes within our body organic technology) 
This is a very intuitive and holistic approach, tailored specifically to what your body is asking and needing, initiation or strengthening your relationship with your body at all levels, physical, emotional, mental, and energetic self.

description:
She Rises: Spring Edition, When was the last time you truly paused?
Not just for a moment between tasks, but long enough to breathe and focus on your own wellbeing?

On the eve of Spring, join us for an afternoon, designed to nourish your soul, rejuvenate your energy and awaken the inspiration you need for the season ahead.
As a business owner, Leadership Coach and active mum of four, Sina Mikaio knows the importance of taking the time to escape the hustle and reset each season. That’s why she created She Rises - Spring Edition. An opportunity for you to step away from the noise, let go of the schedules and reconnect with your own inner wisdom.

Who Is This Workshop For?
This intimate gathering is for the women who:
Feels like she is holding it all—career, family and relationships—and is yearning for a space to finally let go.
Knows she wants more from life, but is seeking clarity on what that is and how to get there.
Is ready to release the stories of self doubt and exhaustion that have been holding her back.
Craves connection not only with herself, but with a circle of like-minded women who just "get it."

What To Expect: Your Journey
Your journey through this immersive afternoon will be woven through three powerful pillars:
Movement: Beginning with a nourishing yoga flow designed to release stored energy from the body, clear your mind and open your channels to receive your own guidance. (All levels welcome).
Mindset: A deep dive into your personal energy. You will learn how it impacts your presence, identify where you are leaking energy, release what no longer serves you and get crystal clear on what you want to call in.
Manifestation: A powerful guided visualisation to connect you with your deepest intuition. This practice will help bring your ideas forth, give you clarity on your next steps and provide you with the tools to build a purposeful pathway towards your goals.

You Will Leave With:
Clarity on your path for the season ahead
Unshakeable Confidence in your own wisdom, intelligence and power
The Courage to take aligned action towards a life you truly love
Actionable tools to regulate your nervous system and manage your energy daily.
A profound sense of feeling grounded, inspired and aligned within yourself.

Tickets available to purchase via eventbrite link below:

https://www.eventbrite.co.nz/e/she-rises-spring-edition-tickets-1550395166679?aff=oddtdtcreator

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
Immerse Yourself in a Journey of Sound & Stillness

Join us for a special evening of harmonizing pure sounds, inspiring music, and deep relaxation at our beautiful space. Let the transformative power of sound guide you into a state of peaceful awareness and inner connection.

- 5:00 PM – 7:00 PM, Saturday, 4th of October
- Investment: $49
- Book here: https://www.wellnessliving.com/rs/event/wild_wellbeing?k_class=100000004277

What to Expect
Give yourself the gift of stillness as you surrender to the healing vibrations of:
- Gongs • Tibetan & Crystal Singing Bowls
- Native American Flutes • Harmonium • Sitar & Esraj
- Bells • Mantra chanting • Sacred Silence

Claudio’s high-quality amplification ensures you *feel* the sound as much as you hear it, creating a fully immersive experience. Allow the waves of resonance to:
- Release physical, mental & emotional tension
- Guide you into deep meditation & heart-centered awareness
- Restore balance & invite inner peace

How to Prepare
- Bring a pillow, blanket, or anything to ensure comfort
- Come with an open heart and an intention (optional)
- Wear loose, cozy clothing

About Claudio Escutia
A 3rd-generation multinstrumentalist from Mexico City, Claudio’s journey spans classical guitar, jazz, and global spiritual traditions. Trained in Indian classical music and Tibetan sound healing (studied in Nepal and India), he brings over a decade of expertise as a Sound Healing practitioner. His music is a bridge between ancient wisdom and modern therapeutic soundscapes.

Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia

It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. Why You Won’t Want to Miss This

A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound

A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal

Limited spaces

Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

description:
Steps To Success - The recipe to competing at your best, Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you become the best athlete possible. No matter your level, weather you are a beginner, an amatuer or a pro, this workshop has the recipe to start competing at your best. You don't even have to be competing! You could just want to do better.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Purchase your ticket here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSfMyBy9iQsriz.../viewform
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
Please make payment into the following account:
Account Name: Rocking Robins Rock N Roll Club
Account #: 06-0773-0877111-00
Particulars: STS
Reference: First + Last Name

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and performance focus with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

description:
Teaching Well - A supportive school for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), Growing attention to staff wellbeing has resulted in many workplace mental wellbeing initiatives. Nevertheless, the concept of staff wellbeing is rarely well-defined, with programs focusing on either work-related stressors or staff wellness approaches.

As part of a well school, it is just as essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Don't miss out! Discover the key principles of wellbeing and build a sustainable, impactful plan for your staff.

Join this workshop tailored for schools & kura, exploring how to promote staff wellbeing in 2025. Learn the theory and practice of promoting wellbeing in staff!
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Providing resources or assistance programmes to help staff manage job stress is a single element of an extensive staff wellbeing plan. Schools commonly start at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum, creating welfare or wellness plans. Learning the differences between welfare, wellness, and wellbeing approaches, including their strengths and weaknesses, is important.

Meta-evaluations reveal that many workplace mental wellbeing programmes lack efficacy due to not addressing organisational and systemic factors that impact wellbeing. Effective staff wellbeing programmes must respond to staff needs and reflect the school's cultural values and character.
Utilizing collective impact, transformational change theory, and Te Whare Tapa Whā, we introduce a conceptual model outlining the eight pillars essential for a staff wellbeing plan. This model's strength lies in its specificity to different settings or occupations, necessitating an in-depth analysis of work nature, dynamics, and inter-relationships.
Based on insights from past workshops and participant feedback, this workshop now provides a comprehensive template for developing staff wellbeing plans.
This workshop does not offer a pre-packaged wellbeing programme. Research indicates that externally imposed wellbeing programmes have limited efficacy in schools. Effective staff wellbeing plans must be rooted in insights gained from reflective analysis and staff consultations. Notably, the consultation process itself is a key wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 20% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
AN OPPORTUNITY FOR LEARNING WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MENTAL WELLBEING PRACTITIONER AND SUICIDOLOGIST, BARRY TAYLOR
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 37 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs.  He has worked extensively with schools both here and overseas supporting management and staff in the event of a suicide. He wrote the first suicide postvention guidelines for schools in 1990, developed the first national suicide prevention guidelines for schools in Australia in 1999 and reviewed and updated the NZ guidelines in 2010.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 20% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.
Organiser Contact Details
Barry Taylor
Principal Consultant |  TaylorMade Training and Consulting
Mobile:  027 241 6979
Email:  registration@4wellbeing.nz   
Website:  www.4wellbeing.nz

Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)

Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

A Breath, Sound & Silence Journey ✨🌌🌬

Held by the Heavens | Bathed in Stillness | Anchored in Cosmic Light

𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬 𝗕𝗘𝗬𝗢𝗡𝗗 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗩𝗘𝗜𝗟 — 𝗪𝗛𝗘𝗥𝗘 𝗦𝗢𝗨𝗟 𝗠𝗘𝗘𝗧𝗦 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗥𝗗𝗨𝗦𝗧 🌌🪐✨️🏕🌠

Nestled within a sacred Sanctuary under the starlit skies of Paraparaumu, you are invited to enter the realm of Ether — the invisible thread that weaves all of life. Here, the boundaries between body, breath, and spirit begin to dissolve into the spaciousness of the cosmos.

Cradled by silence, expanded through breath, and elevated by sound, this ceremony is a subtle, sacred transmission — a remembrance of your soul’s celestial origin.

This soulscape will guide you through:

• Gentle Breathwork to still the body and awaken presence
• Blue Lotus Ritual to open the heart and third eye
• Crystal Singing Bowls & Celestial Light Language
• Shamanic Gong encoded with Star Frequencies
• Intuitive Energy Transmissions
• Integration through Sacred Stillness

𝗕𝗟𝗨𝗘 𝗟𝗢𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝗥𝗜𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗟

Blue Lotus, known as the Flower of the Heavens, has been revered in ancient Egyptian and Eastern traditions as a plant of intuition, divination, and deep heart awakening. As you connect with the energy of Blue Lotus you are invited to soften your edges and expand your awareness into dream-like states — where insight, creativity, and emotional release naturally unfold. She is the guardian of the liminal realms, ushering you gently into etheric remembrance.

𝗕𝗘𝗡𝗘𝗙𝗜𝗧𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬:

• Connection to Divine Feminine & Cosmic Womb
• Inner Peace, Stillness & Mental Clarity

Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

Your only task is to arrive with presence and openness, ready to receive what is already waiting within you.

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 23 Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

The Kava Experience, Bula Vinaka and Welcome to Kava Culture, New Zealand’s newest destination for authentic Fijian Kava!
We are thrilled to invite you to another relaxing Kava Experience night. Whether you're a curious newcomer or a seasoned kava enthusiast, our dedicated team will warmly guide you through every step of this unique journey.
At Kava Culture, we offer a premium, traditionally brewed kava experience designed for wellness-focused individuals seeking natural relaxation. We pride ourselves on sourcing our kava directly from small Pacific Island farms, ensuring unparalleled quality and authenticity.
Immerse yourself in the rich traditions of the Pacific as you enjoy our exquisite kava in our calm, serene location at Kaitahi, beautifully illuminated by ambient lights. This is more than just a drink; it's an opportunity to connect with others, promote genuine stress relief, and celebrate ancient island culture with modern comfort.

description:
The Overthinking Mind - Break Free From Mental Loops, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops

This workshop explores why our thoughts get stuck in loops of worry, doubt, and replay.  Drawing on the insights of Carl Jung, we’ll uncover how the unconscious mind, shadow, and how unresolved inner conflicts fuel over-thinking. You’ll also learn how the body and nervous system become conditioned to repeat these mental patterns, creating the familiar cycle of racing thoughts and restless emotions.

Through a guided exercise, you’ll experience practical tools from FasterEFT and the science of neuroplasticity—methods that help rewire the brain and bring the mind back to calm clarity.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll not only understand the deeper roots of over-thinking, but you’ll also walk away with simple, repeatable techniques to interrupt mental loops, ease the nervous system, and create a lasting sense of inner peace.

“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others and see that many of us face the same challenges beneath the surface—making growth and healing easier when we explore them together :)

“This is an interactive workshop that offers the chance to connect with others on a similar journey. It’s powerful to know, that beneath the surface, we often share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”

Meet your host, Krishnaloka

Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis
If your brain won’t stop running in circles, this workshop is for you.
In 60 minutes, we’ll unpack why your mind loves to overthink, how to break out of thought spirals before they swallow your day, and I’ll guide you through a relaxing hypnosis to quiet the noise on the spot. You’ll leave with simple tools you can use anytime life feels too loud.


Meet your host, Gopi
Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity, overcome negative thought patterns and habits through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, trauma informed coach, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.
6.15pm Tuesday 9th September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
