description:
Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Come and join Jenny Allan for a cup of ceremonial grade cacao and then enjoy a gentle and relaxing restorative yoga practice - twilight edition.

Event details

• What - 1.5 hr yoga session
• When -
TWILIGHT EDITION 7-8.30pm Tuesday 23rd September 2025
MORNING EDITION 10-11.30am Saturday 27th September 2025

• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay
• Cost - $30 per person

• What to bring? Most props are provided but feel free to bring your own yoga mat for extra comfort as well as a cushion, blanket, socks and an eye pillow if you have one.

This class is suitable for all - no previous experience is required.

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE.
TWILIGHT SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/5a2pad44
MORNING SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/mw82z38u

Restorative yoga is a practice of deep relaxation in which yoga poses (asanas) are held for several minutes with the use of props such as blocks, bolster and blankets to support the body in gentle stretch.

When your body enters a state of relaxation, your mind will also relax. Once you have been guided to let go of any tension held in your body, all that is required is for you to pay attention to your breath, becoming aware of any thoughts that may arise, and then gently releasing them.

This restful practice calms both mind and body, allowing the nervous system to enter its parasympathetic state – the state of “rest and digest”, in which healing is enabled and enhanced.

About Cacao
Cacao is a superfood. It is plant medicine at its finest. Its scientific name, Theobroma cacao, translates to "food of the Gods." Containing many minerals, vitamins and phytonutrients such as flavonoids and antioxidants, it is also an extremely potent adaptogen that encourages the body to come into balance.

Cacao has a particularly strong influence on the heart – both physiologically and energetically. Cacao anecdotally is reported to enhance connection in community, hence its beauty in being shared in circle.

In Jenny's experience, cacao seems to enhance whatever it is that you are doing – be it running a marathon or meditating – cacao can make you go deeper, further, longer, stronger. However she does seem to have a mind of her own so be open to the experience she offers you – it may not always go quite how you planned!

Cacao is very safe and tolerated well by most people. However it is to be used with caution by people who are taking high doses of SSRIs. Cacao releases serotonin, so it works as a mild antidepressant. When taken with SSRIs that release serotonin chemically it can lead to serotonin syndrome. Individuals taking MAOIs (monoamine oxidase inhibitors) should avoid consuming ceremonial cacao due to potential interactions.

description:
(Now on Sunday) Planetary Parade - Free event, Due to a heavy cloud forecast on Saturday morning, we have changed the date for this event to the following morning, Sunday 24 August.
A rare cosmic event where six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).

description:
Book Group: Uncle Tom's Cabin by Harriet Beecher Stowe, Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Group we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. The group has been running for more than a decade and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers that come along for particular books or simply when it suits. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

Our October book is Harriet Beecher Stowe's 1852 abolitionist novel Uncle Tom's Cabin; or, Life Among the Lowly. The work changed American hearts and minds about slavery.

The influence of Uncle Tom's Cabin was so immense that the story arose that when Abraham Lincoln welcomed Stowe to the White House during the American Civil War he reportedly declared, "So this is the little lady who started this great war."

In the US, it was the best-selling novel of the 19th century and the second best-selling book of all after the Bible.

Project Gutenberg link for those e-reading:
https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/203

description:
Chess – Learn to Play, Chess is an ancient game of strategy and analysis that hones concentration and focus, as you master the skills allowing you to win at this competitive recreation.
Join tutor, Ryan Hill to learn how to play this game from the beginning.
You will quickly go from understanding the basics to being able to engage in playing confidently and discover where to go for further training or to carry on playing – both in person and online.
Over 600 million people play this game that has remained popular throughout the ages – why don’t you become one of them!
Bring pen and paper to take notes.
By the end of this course you will be able to:
*Be able to use all of the chess pieces to play the game
*Be able to recount and use some of the most common openings and traps
*Recognise where to go for further training or to play
*Develop increasing levels of confidence in your ability to play and possibly win
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Club Night - Fireside Chat with Mark and Gavin, it's all about the punt!, Ever wondered what’s really involved in lifting your chains, checking your blocks, and keeping your boat secure inside the harbour?
Come along and hear Gavin and Mark share their knowledge — including Gavin’s tale of installing blocks for Revenue Cutter inside the boat harbour, and how a “mooring muscle boy” became a rocket!
You’ll learn:
How to inspect chains and spot potential issues
Why regular servicing (every 2 years) is the best protection in heavy winds
The story of the Punt — over 100 years old and still servicing moorings in Clyde Quay
The Mooring Punt isn’t a dark art — it’s a simple winch with rollers that does an important job. This is your chance to see how it works, ask questions, and even book a slot to have your mooring serviced so you can sleep well knowing your boat is secure.

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6, F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6
🎟️ Sign up here: https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6 🎟️

F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington! 🇳🇿


📦 WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?

FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!

Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you. 🙌


🎈 HOW DOES IT WORK?

We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!


🕹 HOW TO JOIN?

Take 2 minutes to fill out our form 👇🏼
https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6

Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma :)


🧧 HOW MUCH IS IT?

The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:

⏰ 3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
🥪 Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
👥 A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
💛 Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
🎫 Also includes those pesky ticket fees!


🌳 WHERE IS IT?

We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.


💛 WHAT THEY SAY

🗣 “Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias


🗣 “This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya


🗣 “F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika


🗣 “I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda


🗣 "it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara


🗣 “Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz


Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7 🫶


🤓 FAQ

• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.


• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings 💛


• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences. ♥️ This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us :)


• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!


• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.


• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form :)

--


𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙. ✨

* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit 💃)


🙅‍♀️📱This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket 🙅‍♀️📱


We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver. 🌍


--

Stay in touch 👇

Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

description:
Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene, Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
Improv For the Stage, Extend your skills in the joy and art of improvisation and step boldly onstage. This course is for those who have completed a beginner course or have other relevant experience.

Laugh, play characters, get them into trouble (and out again!), and see how your skills translate into confident performance.

This is the W.I.T. Level 2 course and will take your improv to the next step beyond the confidence-building of our Joy of Improv and on into collaborative spontaneous theatre creation.

The course is suitable for those who have completed a foundation course either with W.I.T. or another improv troupe or have some theatrical experience or training.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Create characters and stories in open scenes

- Play and perform several classic improv games

- Stay positive and enjoy failure

- Use improvisation terminology to discuss story, character, comedy, theatre, and think about performance (your own and others)

The course will end with a show for invited friends and family.

(This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk.)

description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip, Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.

Also check out other Trips & Adventurous Activities in Wellington.

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon, We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！

description:
Magic: Commander Party Edge of Eternities @ Ceberus Games, Join us for Commander Party! Purchase a booster for entry.
Commander Party is a story-inspired Commander event that immerses players in the setting of the latest set release. The vibe is fun and casual, and the events are outstanding opportunities to welcome in broad groups from your community, from new players to lore enthusiasts to Commander fans.
The event features special rules designed specifically for Edge of Eternities and includes play aids and party cards to support play.
Set up and play follows the regular Commander format rules but players all have these additional abilities:
Special Rules:
Alternate win condition: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control all five worlds, you win the game.
At the beginning of your end step, if one or more opponents lost 3 or more life this turn, gain control of an unclaimed world or a world controlled by one of those opponents.
Whenever you cast your commander, you get an orbit counter.
, pay an orbit counter: choose left or right. Each player passes control of a world they control to the next player in the chosen direction. Activate only as a sorcery.
Each world card also grants a triggered ability whenever a player gains control of it and at the beginning of their upkeep while it is in their control in their command zone.

-

description:
Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future, Marlborough’s tech community has huge potential, and this kōrero is about shaping the next chapter together. We believe our region’s tech future will be stronger when everyone has a seat at the table, and we’re committed to making space for all perspectives to be heard.
Event details
📅 Date: Thursday 18 September 2025
🕘 Time: 10:00 am - 12:00 pm
📍 Location: Te Au Pūngao, cnr Arthur & Seymour Streets
Free to attend, registration is essential for catering purposes.
Join us for morning tea at Te Au Pūngao to connect with others working in technology, innovation, and startups, and to help set the direction for Marlborough’s tech future.
We’ll be talking about:
Making coworking more accessible for sole contractors, early-stage founders, and startups
Creating regular opportunities for local students to get hands-on support from industry experts
Forming a Marlborough Tech Steering Group to guide our community and develop a Tech Community Charter
This is an open kōrero guided by the principle of equity of voice. Whether this is your first tech event or your fiftieth, you belong here. We know it can feel daunting to walk into a new space, so our team will be at the door to welcome you and make introductions.
Everyone brings value to the conversation. Your background, culture, and lived experience help shape a stronger tech community.
Accessibility and inclusivity:
On-site parking, elevator, and accessible bathrooms
Welcoming to LGBTQIA+ community
Attendees are encouraged to bring a friend
Come along, share your ideas, and help build a connected and collaborative tech community in Marlborough.

Monthly Life Drawing, Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

description:
New Zealand Game Developers Conference, New Zealand Game Developers Conference
This is more than just a conference; it’s a celebration of Aotearoa’s amazing game dev community.

Our theme for this year is The People at the Heart of Games and is inspired by the well-known Māori proverb “He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata” (What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people), emphasising the human side of game development.

It speaks to the importance of community, collaboration and the people who shape our industry - developers, storytellers, players, and cultural guardians.

We’ll have inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and vibrant panel discussions that highlight voices from all corners of our industry.

Whether you’re a veteran developer, an enthusiastic gamer, or just starting your journey, NZGDC 2025 is the perfect place to forge new friendships, exchange ideas, and ignite your creativity!

Also check out other Workshops in Wellington.

description:
Omaka Wings & Wheels 28th Sept, Daylight Savings is coming, and so is the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre's Wings & Wheels Open Day! Make sure to mark Sunday, 28th September, 2025, on your calendar to spring forward into an amazing day of aircraft and classic cars!

We have a spectacular lineup of aircraft planned from throughout history, and joy flights will be available. Re-hydrate and refuel at the Omaka Cafe and guest food outlets. Bring your picnic rugs and deck chairs, and make yourself comfortable because you won't want to leave!

And don't forget to take the opportunity to visit the two remarkable exhibitions at the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre. Entry to both is included in your Omaka Wings & Wheels ticket. For value for money, it doesn't get any better than this!
** There will be gate sales on the day. However, we highly recommend that you pre-purchase tickets online for the best price and quickest check-in experience. **

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae Beach - Mothers Tulips, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Waikanae! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: FIRST DRINK IS INCLUDED IN THE TICKET PRICE

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club, Meet new people, make new jewellery, and enjoy your first drink on the house! Pearls & Pints is a faction of our Village Beads Social Collective, which aims to connect people of similar interests as you bond over creating some new pearl jewellery and enjoy some pints (or other beverages!). Come solo and meet new people, or bring some friends along for a fun night at Abandoned Brewery! No beading skills required, our team will help out with all the technical skills at the end.

Create either two freshwater pearl bracelets or one freshwater pearl necklace in this session. We’ll bring a huge selection of different freshwater pearl beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

Bookings and payments required in advance for people aged 18+. Valid ID required upon entry.

description:
Planetary Parade - Free event, Six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
Please note we will postpone the event to if the weather is uncooperative.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

If you're keen to read some of your own original material, come sign up at 6:30pm, or express interest by emailing wesleywritesthings@gmail.com. Performance spots are 6 mins each. Bring poetry (or read something else you've written, like a short story) and koha for the venue please!

We hope to see you there!

description:
Powell Hut Slow Overnight Stay, This is a mid week tramp to beat any rush.
This event is aimed for people wanting to get up to this hut and stay the night as a group but NOT have the stress or pressure to break any speed limits.
The start time is set early to give the maximum amount of walking time to reach the hut destination. Typically it is a 3-4hr walk but even with a huge amount of breaks we will be arriving just in time to have lunch at the top.
There will be regular posted stopping points along the way at Rocky Mt Lookout and again at Mt House Shelter.
You will be in charge of yourself through the trip but we will be there to answer questions and provide the entertainment like always

This is a fully serviced hut with water, gas cooking and a lovely wood burner to heat the hut during our stay.
The walking distance is 7.3km on a well formed track in most parts and formed stairs.
The elevation gain is approximately 500m which brings you to the hut which sits at 1200m above sea level.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pre-order my new book! Homegrown Fruit: A Practical Guide, Pre-order your copy of the book, then come along to Firebird on the 28th and pick it up. I'll sign it, and then we'll settle in for a book chat about 3.15.
Coffee + cake for sale.
Jason and I are so proud of this book! Were stoked to get this practical, useful information out there, and give you the tools to be an epic fruit gardener.
"A book for those who love growing their own fruit, or who want to learn how to do it or do it better – no matter your garden size. It covers it all – where to start, what to look for, what is suitable for your area, how to prep, how to look after and train – you name it, it is in here. A must have and a keeper." Fiona Eadie, author of 100 Best Native Plants for New Zealand Gardens
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!
label: Hobbies & Interests

- PRIZES

You might be wondering how much this incredible night will cost? We present to you a bargain of a life time. $20 at the door gets you night of dirt cheap pinball.
BUT WAIT THERE’S MORE…
For only an extra $5 get your self entered in the NZ's largest monthly tournament, Pōneke Pinballers. Put your skills to the test and play with the best players in the country.

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness
Pulp Fiction
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!

description:
Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39), Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39)

Single? We have got you!



Highlights:

This unique event adds a playful twist to speed dating, allowing singles to connect through fun and games.
Enjoy simple board games like Giant Jenga, perfect for breaking the ice – even if you’re new to games!
Skip the awkward small talk and see how people interact in a relaxed, group setting. Match with someone and get connected for a second date.


You’ll start the night in mixed-gender groups and rotate around to see people of the opposite gender.



Feeling a bit shy? You’ll stay with your same-gendered group through the night, so bring a friend along for the ride!



Drinks are provided, and we have nibbles to keep you fueled. Because, let’s face it, gaming is thirsty work!





After the games wrap up, feel free to hang out with your new acquaintances till 9.15 and play other games.

A match form will be sent out the following day, and we’ll connect you with your matches in the coming days.

Perfect for singles looking to mix fun with the chance to meet someone special.





Recommended age 25-39.

Book now!



Not your vibe? Check out our other upcoming events on our website!
By purchasing a ticket you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms & Conditions.



** If your gender is showing as sold out, join the waitlist! You’ll get a notification if there are cancellations or additional tickets released!

description:
September Shuffleboard Pairs Tournament, Come along to our monthly shuffleboard league!
Register here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/shuffleboard
Shuffleboard pairs tournaments are 6pm to 9.30pm at the latest (usually earlier), the last Wednesday of each month.
Check out the league over at Challonge.com
https://challonge.com/communities/meanshuffle
Tournament Rules:
This is a double elimination format tournament. Teams must lose twice to be eliminated. Matches are played according to standard shuffleboard rules as can be read here:
https://www.theshufflehouse.com/.../how-to-play...
EXCEPT:
- There is a 10 MINUTE time limit each match.
- Matches are played FIRST TO TEN.
- In the event of a draw after the 10 minute time limit, a "Golden End" will be played. The winner of the Golden End wins the match.
- Pucks that do not pass the foul line are removed from play.
- The shuffleboard will be reset and resanded after each match.
- No sand will be added during a match.
- The final match is played first to 15 with no time limit - if time allows.
- Every "Hanger" is rewarded with a sweet treat!
PRIZES
1st place: $60 of Taproom Vouchers + 1st place ribbon + Your team name immortalised on the honours board
2nd place: $40 of Taproom Vouchers + 2nd place ribbon

The Dancing & Drinking Society, The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s Blues & Jass.

Their repertoire includes many of the Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags, and Blues that our great-grandparents would have shimmied to in the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.

Although this combo has a mere 4 members, it has the impact of a full Syncopating-Orchestra, with multiple instruments being played simultaneously by multiple band members.

Blair “Sweet-Lips” Latham - Clarinet, Bass Clarinet, Tenor Saxophone
Mat “Mon Colonel” Enright - Trumpet, Resonator Guitar, Vocals
Adrian “AJ” Jensen - Gypsy Guitar, Bass Drum
Daniel “Pappy” Yeabsley -Tuba, Hi-Hat.

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/
label: Hobbies & Interests

The Wellington Calling Open Mic: Daylight Savings Theme!, Wellington's premier event venue Whisky and Wood is hosting its 5th open mic event: Wellington Calling and we're looking for diverse acts to contribute!

Our last event event had 15 performers and we want you to contribute to the next!

Each performer gets the chance to have a six- minute set with a microphone, guitar and keyboard provided.

This is an originals only event. We want to encourage new creative voices to be heard.

“We want to provide a positive and encouraging environment for established and fledgling acts to shine in. It's a pretty inspiring place to perform,” says host Steven Hood.

Each performer will need to sign up in person before 7pm and registrations of interest need to be emailed to openwandw@gmail.com before May 25.

The feature act is Mustang a upcoming three-piece with dreamy harmonies. Their songs are emotional tributes to clarity, light and wonder. Expect to be moved!

Their music can be heard at: https://www.instagram.com/mustang_band24/

Entry is with Koha.

Light food and drinks will be available to purchase.

description:
Try Something New - Build, Paint, Play - School Holidays, School Holidays are a great if you have always wanted to get into the Warhammer hobby or if you are you looking to Try something new & want help with your next activity on your Warhammer journey.
It's also great if you want to improve your hobby skills.
Below you will find a few of the many Free hobby lessons we run at Warhammer Wellington
Introductory demonstrations: pick between a free introductory Stormcast or Space Marine model and then you can learn to build, paint and play a game with it.
Warhammer Build, Paint, Play Workshops are between 15min - 45mins
Learn to Build:
Learn how to build your miniatures & build your first model or a Free Miniature of the Month.
Learn to Paint:
Learn how to use Base, Shade, Layers, Contrast & Technical paints.
Learn to Play:
Learn more about the rules of your favorite game or try out a
new game.
All great ways to do the next step in your hobby journey while also getting your Battle Honours activities stamped off so remember to bring your activity book with you when you visit!
New to the Warhammer hobby & want to discover more about collecting, building, painting, playing Warhammer?

No need to book, just drop in or give us a call 04 471 098 to find out more

description:
Unity Book Club October 2025 | Cursed Daughters, About the book: 
No man will call your house his home. And if they try, they will not have peace...

So goes the family curse, long handed down from generation to generation, ruining families and breaking hearts. And now it's Eniiyi's turn - who, due to her uncanny resemblance to her dead aunt, Monife, is already used to her family's strange beliefs, as well as their insistence that she is a reincarnation. Still, when she falls in love with the handsome boy she saves from drowning, she can no longer run from her family's history. Is she destined to live out the habitual story of love and heartbreak, or can she escape the family curse and the mysterious fate that befell her aunt?

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In October we will be discussing Cursed Daughters by Oyinkan Braithwaite.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

description:
Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends, Melissa and Eden host our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.
For the month of August we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
In the cold Wellington winter, Omar’s grades are slipping, his mum is unwell and his best friend is growing distant. Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Before the Winter Ends explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
Limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner, rather than later and tell your friends and whānau. Drinks and snacks are provided.

description:
WOW Train VIP Experience ex Christchurch : SOLD OUT, Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing Friday 26 September, 2025

Beginning in Christchurch or Kaikoura, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the pacific coastline aboard the Coastal Pacific WOW Train and Interislander Ferry. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with an accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience, journeying along the coastline and over the strait past marine habitats aboard the Coastal Pacific and Interislander. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with the Gold ticket to see the World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Saturday 27 September and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train aboard the Coastal Pacific (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!) and VIP Ferry journey on the Interislander on 26 September
Onboard WOW entertainment and a goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

description: Watch the Stars Megagame, In Watch the Stars, players represent governments that are members of a galactic council, struggling to resolve their competing interests in trade and colonisation, while at the same time facing a crisis caused by mysterious raids on border colonies. Players are in teams of 2-4 people, with game roles focused on leadership, military command, trade and economic development, and scientific research. Gameplay can be frenetic, with strict time limits on diplomatic negotiations, and no two megagames will every be alike, as players can create special actions in every game.

description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Wellington - Oh Deer!, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

Mingle with new sewing friends and say cheers over a shared passion of this craft. Whether you're an expert or beginner, this event is for you.

You will need to be 18+ to attend this event.

Please note: A photographer is present at this event. Photos taken may be used for marketing purposes in future event promotions

description:
Wellington Rowing Club AGM, Lotto 8’s & Season Opening, The Wellington Rowing Club Annual General Meeting (AGM) and opening of the season will be held on Sunday 24 August 2024, 12 noon, at the WRC Function Centre.
We look forward to seeing you all at the Club at 9:30 for Lotto 8’s (weather permitting).
Following the meetings, a light lunch will be provided. This is also WRC’s opportunity to unveil the Function Space renovations to the membership.

Information about the AGM
The WRC AGM will commence at 12noon, in the WRC Function Centre. There will be provisions for online attendance.
At this year’s AGM, we have several board and committee positions that we will be seeking to fill. Many hands make light work, and we all depend on volunteers to keep the club growing and thriving. A variety of experience levels, skill sets, and perspectives are needed for a well-functioning club.
The positions to be filled this year are:
-Club Captain (2-year term, Officer role)
-Vice President (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Treasurer (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Secretary (2-year term, Officer role)
-3 Committee roles (1-year term, non-Officer role)
-3 Board members (2-year term, Officer role)
Officers of the must consent in writing to being an officer and certify that they are eligible and not disqualified from holding office as described under section 36B of the Charities Act 2005.
The Club by-laws outline the current role descriptions, can be found here, note that the roles can be tailored to suit individuals’ skill sets and experience. Mentoring and support can be provided to develop individuals in these positions.
If you are interested, but have further questions- please reach out to the people holding the current role or any of the board or committee members to discuss.

want to join others in each doing our own thing? ever dream about a future where technology, nature, and society mutually support each other in harmony?
introducing art~hack wellington's weekly jam: a safe space to discover, create, and share creative solarpunk energies with other (shy & introverted) humans.

description:
Artisan Craft Market, The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Wellington City on the Waterfront at Wharewaka O Poneke venue.

description:
Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day, Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day
✨ Erskine Chapel Open Day & Craft Market ✨
📅 Sunday, 2 November 2025 | 10:00am – 3:00pm
📍 Erskine Chapel, 31 Avon Street, Island Bay, Wellington

Nestled high on the hillside in Island Bay, Erskine Chapel is a breathtaking and iconic landmark, with sweeping views across the hills and ocean, and a gothic charm that has captured hearts for generations.

Now in its third year, this much loved annual event returns as part of Heritage Month, celebrating the beauty, history, and cultural significance of one of Wellington’s most treasured buildings.

Foxtail Events and The Wellington Company are once again partnering to open the chapel’s doors for the community, inviting everyone to experience this remarkable space brought back to life.

Join us for a special Community Open Day and Craft Market, where you can:

* Explore a curated market of local artisans and makers
* Discover the chapel’s rich history and stunning architecture
* Enjoy live music, freshly brewed coffee, and delicious baked goods

Whether you're drawn by the history, the creativity, or the peaceful atmosphere, this is a day to celebrate local talent and honour the legacy of a true Wellington landmark.

🗓️ Mark your calendar and don’t miss this enchanting day at Erskine Chapel. A place of stories, memories, and timeless beauty, reawakened for a new generation to enjoy.

description:
Fabric-a-brac 2025, Fabric-a-brac returns to Wellington for our second event in 2025!

The first Fabric-a-brac was held in Wellington 15 years ago - we're sew excited to still be here, bring the sewing community together and raising money for Mary Potter Hospice.
Fabric-a-brac is a fun fabric and sewing supplies market where you can shop for vintage and modern sewing and upholstery fabric, patterns, haberdashery and more. It brings the sewing community together to share stashes, stories and delight in our mutual love of textiles.
Fabric-a-brac is volunteer-run, and is a fundraiser for hospice - in Wellington this is Mary Potter Hospice. All profits from this event are donated to their work. We've raised $80,000 since our first event in 2009.
Selling fabric
If you have a stash you'd like to sell, you can come and take a stall. You pay a stallholder fee (which goes to Hospice) but anything you make on the day is yours to keep. Stalls are allocated via a ballot, which will take place closer to the time. Go to our website to find the form. Closes mid August.

If you have fabric, haberdashery or patterns you'd like to move on, but don't want to have a table, you can donate items. This will all go onto the hospice table on the day, and all profits will go to their wonderful work.
Fabric donation points
- Made Marion
- Mary Potter Hospice - you can take donations to the Mary Potter Hospice in Mein St, Newtown

Pop-up cafe
The fabulous cafe is back with all of its gorgeous volunteers and fab food. There will be tea, coffee and sweet treats for sale, so you can sit down and chat over your new projects and fabric purchases. All proceeds from the cafe also go to Hospice.
Buying fabric
Bring cash - most stallholders and the cafe will be selling by cash only.
We look forward to seeing our fabulous fabric and sewing community soon!
*Saturday September 20 2025
*St Anne's Parish Hall, Emmett Street, Newtown, Wellington

description:

Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 11 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

Foxtail Events is beyond excited to bring the beloved Botanist Market to the Kāpiti Coast for the very first time — and we can’t wait to share it with you! Join us at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall for a lush, leafy celebration of all things green, gorgeous, and garden-inspired.

Whether you're a seasoned plant whisperer or simply love beautiful spaces filled with botanical charm, this market is your perfect winter escape!

Expect a vibrant mix of:
* Indoor & outdoor plants
* Botanical art, fashion & homewares
* Ceramics, planters & garden decor
* Natural skincare & eco beauty products
* Seedlings, garden tools & plant accessories
... and so much more!

This is more than just a market — it’s a community of plant lovers, creatives, and eco-conscious makers coming together in one gorgeous space.

Come see why the Botanist Market has captured hearts across Wellington — and now, it's your turn, Kāpiti! Bring a friend, bring your plant wishlist, and don’t miss this brand new local gem.

description:
Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026, Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
Get ready for a day of love, celebration, and unforgettable inspiration at the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026 – the Kapiti Coast’s premier event for anyone planning a wedding, special event, or milestone celebration. Taking place on Sunday, 19 April 2026, from 10am to 3pm at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, this vibrant expo brings together over 40 of the region’s top wedding and event professionals, all in one beautiful space. Best of all? Entry is completely FREE!

From breathtaking florals and stunning venue styling to expert celebrants, creative photographers, world-class entertainment, and delectable food and drink offerings, this expo has it all. Whether you’re newly engaged, planning a birthday bash, organising a corporate event, or simply love all things celebration, the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is your one-stop destination for inspiration and expert advice.

This year’s expo promises an immersive experience packed with exclusive show-only offers, giveaways, and dazzling live performances on the Main Stage. Meet the creative minds behind Kapiti’s most iconic celebrations, explore dreamy decor ideas, and uncover the latest wedding and event trends that will help you bring your vision to life. Our hand-picked exhibitors are the best in the business, offering fresh ideas and tailored solutions to make your event truly unforgettable.

But that’s not all – your free ticket also unlocks exclusive deals across the Kapiti Coast. From boutique shopping and cosy cafes to scenic stays and local attractions, our Explore Kapiti program gives you access to fantastic discounts and experiences from our local business partners. Simply show your expo ticket to take advantage of these offers while you’re in town.

The Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is proudly brought to you by Kapiti Castles, experienced event organisers who understand how to make moments magical. With a deep love for creativity, community, and connection, we’ve crafted this event to help you dream big and plan with confidence.

So don’t miss out – grab your free tickets today and join us for an extraordinary day of discovery, excitement, and inspiration. Whether you're planning a wedding, a party, or something truly unique, this is where your perfect celebration begins.

description:
Kāpiti Food Fair 2025, All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti

description:
Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective, Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective
✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective ✨

Saturday 6th September · 11am – 2pm · Paraparaumu

For one day only, Lightbody Jewellery is journeying to Paraparaumu.

We’re honoured to be welcomed into Copperfield Collective, bringing with us a collection of our most sought-after treasures.

💫 Meet the maker – learn the stories and symbols hidden in every piece.

💫 Try on sacred treasures – jewellery alive with meaning, energy, and transformation.

💫 Feel the magic woven into silver and gold – creations that choose their keepers.

About Lightbody Jewellery

We are a small New Zealand brand, born from nothing but vision and persistence, built piece by piece, story by story. Lightbody Jewellery grew out of a desire to carry ancient symbols into the present, weaving spirit into matter so that jewellery could once again guide, teach, and protect.

Every pendant, ring, and talisman is handcrafted here in Aotearoa with intention. They are not made to follow trends, they are made to awaken, to empower, to transform.

What began as a spark has grown into a living brand carried by intuition, mystery, and craft. Each piece finds its keeper when the time is right.

This pop-up at Copperfield Collective is more than a display.
It’s a rare chance to meet the maker, hold the work, and feel which treasure has been waiting for you.

✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up
📍 Copperfield Collective - 17 Seaview Road, Paraparaumu Beach
📅 Saturday 6th September
🕚 11am – 2pm

description:
Not Your Nana's Craft Market - R18 Art and Craft Market, *Strictly R18*
Are you ready for a unique and thrilling experience? Look no further! We invite you to the most captivating event of the year - the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!

What to Expect
Get ready to immerse yourself in a world where art and craft meet the dark and mysterious. This market is not for the faint of heart! Here's what you can expect:
1. Creepy-Cute Delights: Explore a wide range of art and craft creations that blend the creepy and cute aesthetics. From adorable monsters to spooky dolls, you'll find something to tickle your fancy.
2. Witchy Wonders: Dive into the world of witchcraft and magic. Discover spellbinding artwork, mystical jewelry, and enchanting potions. Embrace your inner witch or warlock!
3. Kinky Curiosities: For those who enjoy a touch of kink, we have a selection of unique and provocative art and crafts, and kink wear. Explore the boundaries of sensuality and embrace your desires in a safe and inclusive environment.
4. Sexy Sensations: Indulge in the world of sensuality and erotic art. Discover captivating paintings, sculptures, and photography that celebrate the beauty of the human form. Embrace your sexuality with pride!
5. LGBTQIA+ Friendly: This market is a safe space for all members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Celebrate diversity and inclusivity as you explore the wide range of art and craft offerings.
6. Alternative Art and Craft: Step outside the mainstream and explore the alternative side of creativity. From gothic to steampunk, from punk to cyberpunk, you'll find a variety of unique and unconventional art and craft pieces.
Join Us!

Don't miss out on this extraordinary event! Mark your calendars and invite your friends. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little bit spooked. See you at the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!
It definitely will NOT be your nana's market! See less

description:
Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market, Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market
✨ Discover Wellington’s Most Enchanting Market! ✨

Set against the breathtaking backdrop of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most iconic heritage landmarks, the Old St Paul’s Craft & Curio Market is a boutique shopping experience like no other.

As part of this year’s Wellington Heritage Festival, the grounds of Old St Paul’s will be transformed into a vibrant marketplace filled with handpicked stalls offering treasures and treats you won’t find anywhere else. Explore lovingly crafted leather goods, upcycled garments, wellness creations, handmade chocolates, collectibles and curiosities, houseplants, dyed wool, children’s accessories, fine embroidery, jams and preserves, artisan breads and baked goods, Christmas decorations, candles, and so much more.

But it’s not just shopping – this is a day steeped in atmosphere. The lawn and forecourt will come alive with heritage-themed games and activities, alongside captivating live demonstrations from the Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild and the Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers.

With its central location just minutes from the Railway Station and bus hub – and plenty of on-street parking – this is your chance to enjoy a heritage day out that’s easy to get to, and unforgettable once you arrive.

Fun for the whole whānau, supporting the ongoing care of this national treasure.

Koha entry. Refreshments available.
